mir210.flavor: Love is like a rhino, short-sighted and hasty; if it cannot find a way, it will make a way. —Femeref adage
mir210.title: Crash of Rhinos

pls135.flavor: Designed like the gargadons of Keld—big and brutal.
pls135.title: Stratadon

ody46.flavor: Good strategists seize opportunities. Great strategists make their own.
ody46.title: Shelter

8ed152.flavor: A drop of humanity for a sea of power.
8ed152.title: Phyrexian Arena

mrd11.flavor: The skyhunters were born when the first leonin gazed at the heavens and wished to hunt the birds overhead.
mrd11.title: Leonin Skyhunter

5dn32.flavor: They only appear in emergencies, and emergencies never last long.
5dn32.title: Hoverguard Sweepers

sok102.flavor: Hidetsugu never relinquished a grudge. He let it burn within him, gathering ever greater intensity until the final moment of vengeance.
sok102.title: Hidetsugu's Second Rite

9ed269.flavor: The wurms become so big, a single scale can be used as a roof for a human dwelling.
9ed269.title: Scaled Wurm

rav4.flavor:
"Through the haze of battle I saw the glint of sun on golden mane, the sheen of glory clad in mail, and I dropped my sword and wept at the idiocy of war."
—Dravin, Gruul deserter
rav4.title: Blazing Archon

dis34.flavor: He unmakes the world in his own image.
dis34.title: Tidespout Tyrant

10e317.flavor: [Buried under a thin layer of dirt, it was known for centuries as Mount Sardia.]
10e317.title: Colossus of Sardia

lrw220.flavor: In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods.
lrw220.title: Imperious Perfect

mor32.flavor: Oona's song is like a twisted dinner chime. All the faeries return home, but it is Oona who feasts—on the stolen dreams and rumors they serve her.
mor32.title: Distant Melody

mor15.flavor: Ambidexterity is common among kithkin. The thoughtweft links the minds of the left- and right-handed, giving each the knack of the other.
mor15.title: Kinsbaile Cavalier

shm237.flavor: Whole again in honor and horn.
shm237.title: Rhys the Redeemed

shm162.flavor: "He is a ghost that has never known life." —The Seer's Parables
shm162.title: Ghastlord of Fugue

m10114.flavor: Darkness doesn't always send its minions to do its dirty work.
m10114.title: Tendrils of Corruption

m1034.flavor: "One does not question the size or shape of the grains of sand in an hourglass. Nor do I question the temperament of the souls under my guidance."
m1034.title: Soul Warden

m10216.flavor: Regardless of the century, plane, or species, developing artificers never fail to invent the ornithopter.
m10216.title: Ornithopter

m10100.flavor: Its victims are known by their eyes: shattered vessels leaking broken dreams.
m10100.title: Hypnotic Specter

wwk42.flavor:
"The longer the journey, the more one learns."
—Isanke, Halimar seastalker
wwk42.title: Treasure Hunt

roe153.flavor: It traps an explosion within its stony skin.
roe153.title: Kiln Fiend

roe184.flavor: "All life is driven by an indomitable will to survive. I simply turn that into something more . . . tangible."
roe184.title: Gigantomancer

m11172.flavor: She wears the talismans of every creature she can evoke.
m11172.title: Fauna Shaman

m1192.flavor: The locks on the cages of the damned are opened with keys of marrow, sinew, and blood.
m1192.title: Demon of Death's Gate

ddf27.flavor:
"Finally, I understand. Home isn't where you rest. It's what you fight for."
—Elspeth Tirel
ddf27.title: Crusade

me468.flavor: Seafarers fear sailing off the world's edge not so much as down its gullet.
me468.title: Thing from the Deep

cmd79.flavor: Those who hear its roar perish. The lucky ones only feel its fetid breath.
cmd79.title: Dread Cacodemon

cmd128.flavor: "Granted, it's the pinnacle of utter destructiveness. So what would you call two of them?" —Riku of Two Reflections
cmd128.title: Magmatic Force

avr106.flavor:
"Avacyn emerged from the broken Helvault, but her freedom came at a price—him."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar
avr106.title: Griselbrand

m1372.flavor: "The seas are vast, but the skies are even more so. Why be content with one kingdom when I can rule them both?"
m1372.title: Talrand, Sky Summoner

nph37.flavor: "It is not a goal, but a process—the process of creating the perfect Phyrexia."
nph37.title: Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

zen13.flavor: No more shall the righteous cower before evil.
zen13.title: Iona, Shield of Emeria

gtc216.flavor: Those who regard the Gruul as savage simpletons underestimate the subtle power of their shamans.
gtc216.title: Burning-Tree Emissary

ths12.flavor: "You. Poet. Be sure to write this down."
ths12.title: Fabled Hero

ths36.flavor: Trust is the only bridle a pegasus will accept.
ths36.title: Wingsteed Rider

ths42.flavor: The wills of mortals shift as the tide ebbs and flows.
ths42.title: Bident of Thassa

ths90.flavor: Destiny exalts a chosen few, but even heroes break.
ths90.title: Hero's Downfall

ths101.flavor: The dead know lessons the living haven't learned.
ths101.title: Read the Bones

jou66.flavor: Crippling fear precedes it. A foul stench accompanies it. Death follows in its wake.
jou66.title: Doomwake Giant

c1370.flavor:
"As with any malevolent being, the trick is knowing how long you can afford to keep it in your service."
—Liliana Vess
c1370.title: Baleful Force

vma51.flavor: The smallest seed of regret can bloom into redemption.
vma51.title: Swords to Plowshares

vma63.flavor:
"Do as I think, not as I do."
—Jace Beleren
vma63.title: Control Magic

vma283.flavor: Lost to time is the artificer's art of trapping light from a distant star in a ring of purest gold.
vma283.title: Sol Ring

ori175.flavor: "From a tiny sprout, the greatest trees grow and flourish. May the seeds of your mind be equally fruitful."
ori175.title: Elvish Visionary

bfz15.flavor: A force as voracious as time itself.
bfz15.title: Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger

xln2.flavor: "Let no trace of the vampires' foulness remain."
xln2.title: Ashes of the Abhorrent

xln3.flavor: The Church of Dusk teaches there is no gain without loss, no triumph without sacrifice, no drink of exquisite crimson without a dying gasp.
xln3.title: Axis of Mortality

xln4.flavor: Its roaring challenge is punctuated by the slam of its tail on the earth, rousing the herds of the plains.
xln4.title: Bellowing Aegisaur

xln5.flavor: "In the death of the foe lies the resurrection of the faithful."
xln5.title: Bishop of Rebirth

xln6.flavor: Vampires, the noble class of old Torrezon, are guided by their dual loyalties to church and crown.
xln6.title: Bishop's Soldier

xln7.flavor: Vampires know blood and the systems that carry it. And they know exactly where to strike to set it free.
xln7.title: Bright Reprisal

xln8.flavor: "The River Heralds carve spells into jade, hoping to steer us from our course. But what right do they have to keep us from that which once was ours?"
xln8.title: Demystify

xln11.flavor: Paladins of the Sanctum Seeker order are an adventurous lot, venturing into the wilds with monstrous mastiffs at their side.
xln11.title: Encampment Keeper

xln12.flavor: "The blood of the enemy is a sacrament. The strength it gives is proof that our cause is just."
xln12.title: Glorifier of Dusk

xln13.flavor:
"Follow her footsteps and she will show you the way."
—Itzama the Crested
xln13.title: Goring Ceratops

xln14.flavor: Its assistance is unnervingly similar to its hunting technique.
xln14.title: Imperial Aerosaur

xln15.flavor: "Together my mount and I are stronger than either of us apart."
xln15.title: Imperial Lancer

xln16.flavor: "The Immortal Sun will bring us true eternal life to replace the everlasting shadow of undeath."
xln16.title: Inspiring Cleric

xln17.flavor: Jace awoke to the certainty that he was lost.
xln17.title: Ixalan's Binding

xln18.flavor: The people of the Sun Empire worship the sun in three aspects. Kinjalli is the Wakening Sun, who created humans from clay and baked them in the sun's warmth.
xln18.title: Kinjalli's Caller

xln19.flavor:
"There are moments when I feel I could fly like the sunwing. Far away I would soar, but always a golden gale pushes me back."
—Huatli
xln19.title: Kinjalli's Sunwing

xln20.flavor: The Legion of Dusk sailed from Torrezon in search of glory, riches, and the Immortal Sun.
xln20.title: Legion Conquistador

xln21.flavor: "My lance was once wielded by Venerable Tarrian. In his name and by his might, I cast you down!"
xln21.title: Legion's Judgment

xln23.flavor: Nature can't be tamed, but the Sun Empire believes that humans are made stronger when they test themselves against the wild strength of the dinosaurs.
xln23.title: Looming Altisaur

xln24.flavor: In the rapture of his Blood Fast, he destroyed the navigator's tools and steered the ship to shore by faith alone.
xln24.title: Mavren Fein, Dusk Apostle

xln25.flavor: Closely linked to the Church of Dusk, the paladins of the Bloodstained order are devout to the point of fanaticism.
xln25.title: Paladin of the Bloodstained

xln26.flavor: "Ours is the true and righteous path. You will bow before our might."
xln26.title: Pious Interdiction

xln28.flavor: "To rise like the sun—there is no greater feeling."
xln28.title: Pterodon Knight

xln29.flavor:
"Let the blood of the impure flow through you. Only the blessings of the golden city will purge its acrid taste from your mouth."
—High Marshal Arguel
xln29.title: Queen's Commission

xln30.flavor:
"The sun's strength sings in our hearts! I have never been more proud of my home and my people."
—Huatli
xln30.title: Rallying Roar

xln31.flavor: A raptor will follow any order as long as that order is "hunt," "kill," or "go for the guts."
xln31.title: Raptor Companion

xln32.flavor: "Nothing is more sacred than the gift of blood. Blessed are the vein that empties and the heart that is renewed."
xln32.title: Ritual of Rejuvenation

xln33.flavor: "As the sun sets to make way for dawn, so we turn to darkness to bring about the coming salvation."
xln33.title: Sanguine Sacrament

xln35.flavor: Those who wield the power of the sun protect the Empire from darkness.
xln35.title: Sheltering Light

xln36.flavor:
"The invaders cloak themselves in the shadows of dusk. Aerosaurs hide in the brilliance of the noonday sun."
—Caparocti Sunborn
xln36.title: Shining Aerosaur

xln37.flavor: Vampires call the gift of flight "exultation." For their enemies, it brings only sorrow.
xln37.title: Skyblade of the Legion

xln38.flavor:
"The amber sun smokes with fury, gazing on foes that gather like ants invading our home. We are ready! Blade and claw strike as one."
—Huatli
xln38.title: Slash of Talons

xln39.flavor:
"Like the mighty armasaur, we will defend against all who invade our shores."
—Itzama the Crested
xln39.title: Steadfast Armasaur

xln41.flavor: From the eyes up, it's solid bone and stubbornness.
xln41.title: Territorial Hammerskull

xln42.flavor: The glorious city of Pachatupa is the center of the Sun Empire, and Tocatli, the emperor's palace, is its glowing heart.
xln42.title: Tocatli Honor Guard

xln43.flavor: The Feast of Blood sends new life essence flowing through the vampire who partakes, manifesting as even greater strength and speed.
xln43.title: Vampire's Zeal

xln44.flavor:
"Kinjalli's encompassing rays herald new life in the moment of the sun's dawning."
—Chitlati, Lightning Rider
xln44.title: Wakening Sun's Avatar

xln45.flavor: As the ship approached, the jade totem rose high overhead. Power rippled. Eyes of stone glowed and crackled. Out hissed a breath of the world, and a windstorm came alive.
xln45.title: Air Elemental

xln48.flavor: While other pirates prowl for treasure, Captain Parrish plunders secrets.
xln48.title: Chart a Course

xln50.flavor: "Welcome aboard, mate! You're going to need this."
xln50.title: Deadeye Quartermaster

xln51.flavor: A visit to the Deeproot Tree and its ancient spring replenishes a merfolk's connection to nature.
xln51.title: Deeproot Waters

xln52.flavor: Pockets full of gold, lungs full of brine.
xln52.title: Depths of Desire

xln53.flavor: "Seeing the river is not the same as seeing the fish."
xln53.title: Dive Down

xln55.flavor: The stronger the will, the more bewitching the song.
xln55.title: Entrancing Melody

xln56.flavor:
"Like ribbons of wind and wisdom the coatls fly, twisting mystery into truth, shaping the clouds to suit their inscrutable will."
—Huatli
xln56.title: Favorable Winds

xln57.flavor: "Captain, I think that island is following us."
xln57.title: Fleet Swallower

xln58.flavor: "The elders say that if the intruders discovered the secret of the golden city, it would mean an end to our people."
xln58.title: Headwater Sentries

xln59.flavor: "You might as well try to stop the waterfall."
xln59.title: Herald of Secret Streams

xln61.flavor: "I know these waters better than you know yourselves."
xln61.title: Kopala, Warden of Waves

xln62.flavor: Her song plucks the strings of the storm, shifting wind and storm into a harmony that will carry her ship to safety.
xln62.title: Lookout's Dispersal

xln63.flavor: "You won't be needing this. Or this. Or these . . ."
xln63.title: Navigator's Ruin

xln64.flavor:
"River and sea, jungle and sky. Water flows freely between the two halves of the world. We are creatures of the water."
—Shaper Tuvasa
xln64.title: One With the Wind

xln65.flavor: "It's easy to anticipate Captain Storm's orders: take the more dangerous route."
xln65.title: Opt

xln66.flavor: The truth came to Kumena like the Great River's torrent: the only way to keep his enemies away from the hidden city was to claim its power for himself.
xln66.title: Overflowing Insight

xln67.flavor: For the first time in her life, Vraska tried to prevent death.
xln67.title: Perilous Voyage

xln68.flavor: Nothing warms the heart like plunder.
xln68.title: Pirate's Prize

xln69.flavor: The floating city of High and Dry hasn't yet sunk under the weight of gold, but it's not for want of trying.
xln69.title: Prosperous Pirates

xln70.flavor: No ripples, no splashes, no warning.
xln70.title: River Sneak

xln71.flavor: Carefully following the thaumatic compass Bolas had given her, Vraska blundered straight into the River Heralds' trap.
xln71.title: River's Rebuke

xln72.flavor:
"That's the first time I've seen the ground do the running."
—Captain Brinely Rage
xln72.title: Run Aground

xln73.flavor: In the Brazen Coalition, the wheels of business are greased with plunder.
xln73.title: Sailor of Means

xln75.flavor: The River Heralds would wreck a thousand ships to keep intruders from finding the golden city.
xln75.title: Shaper Apprentice

xln76.flavor: One pirate's wreck is another's reward.
xln76.title: Shipwreck Looter

xln77.flavor: Over their long life spans, the larger trilobites accumulate vast treasure troves in their guts.
xln77.title: Shore Keeper

xln79.flavor: He's the calm that hides the coming storm.
xln79.title: Siren Stormtamer

xln80.flavor: Deception and misdirection are the heart of the pirate's arsenal.
xln80.title: Siren's Ruse

xln81.flavor:
"A fool's fire is quickly quenched."
—Shaper Kumena
xln81.title: Spell Pierce

xln83.flavor: "Only one thing beats the freedom of the sea: the freedom of the sky."
xln83.title: Storm Fleet Aerialist

xln84.flavor: "They're searching in the same direction we are. And for the same thing, I'll wager."
xln84.title: Storm Fleet Spy

xln85.flavor: In his hands, the wind can become a weapon or a means of escape.
xln85.title: Storm Sculptor

xln87.flavor: The river is a powerful friend.
xln87.title: Watertrap Weaver

xln88.flavor: "Currents are currents, whether in sea or sky."
xln88.title: Wind Strider

xln89.flavor: Inspiration is red as rubies, flowing like honeyed wine.
xln89.title: Anointed Deacon

xln90.flavor: . . . to the lost temple of a bat-god of night, eternal enemy to the Threefold Sun.
xln90.title: Temple of Aclazotz

xln91.flavor: "They shall give us all they have as penance for their resistance. Their ships. Their goods. Their rebellious blood."
xln91.title: Bishop of the Bloodstained

xln92.flavor: It withers fruit and flesh alike.
xln92.title: Blight Keeper

xln93.flavor: When a paladin undertaking the Blood Fast finally gives in to hunger, the violence is sudden, explosive, and complete.
xln93.title: Bloodcrazed Paladin

xln95.flavor: For a price, the floating city of High and Dry offers all the amenities a pirate could want: rest, recreation, and revenge.
xln95.title: Contract Killing

xln96.flavor: No lock of iron is a match for Vraska's will of stone.
xln96.title: Costly Plunder

xln97.flavor: Demons lurk in the shadows of ancient ruins, spreading plague and corruption across the land.
xln97.title: Dark Nourishment

xln98.flavor: Despite their noble heritage, the pirates of the Deadeye Fleet are known for underhanded tactics and despicable trickery.
xln98.title: Deadeye Tormentor

xln100.flavor: "Ancient one, we have reached the promised shore. The Immortal Sun is near. Drink and awake."
xln100.title: Deathless Ancient

xln101.flavor: A pirate crew without a ship is a crew that will do anything to get one.
xln101.title: Desperate Castaways

xln102.flavor: Among the pirates of the Brazen Coalition, the only thing more dangerous than failure is success.
xln102.title: Dire Fleet Hoarder

xln104.flavor: His fists fume with the decay of death, each strike a plague on the hearts of his enemies.
xln104.title: Dire Fleet Ravager

xln105.flavor: Solitude and starvation are brutal punishments, but even worse is all that time to think.
xln105.title: Duress

xln106.flavor: "Join me, and take the world for yourself!"
xln106.title: Fathom Fleet Captain

xln107.flavor: "It was a bad evening for you, mate. Now it's chow time for the sharks."
xln107.title: Fathom Fleet Cutthroat

xln108.flavor: When the battle is over, the bitterest foes at last find common ground.
xln108.title: Grim Captain's Call

xln111.flavor:
"Shadow birthed it. The moon gave it eyes, and the jungle gave it teeth. But it was Death that taught it cruelty."
—Huatli
xln111.title: Lurking Chupacabra

xln113.flavor:
"Through your sacrifice of self, you become holy. Through your strength, all will be saved."
—From the Rite of Redemption
xln113.title: Mark of the Vampire

xln115.flavor: The soldiers of the Legion of Dusk have come to the colonies at Queen's Bay in search of glory and riches. They are veterans of centuries of warfare, and they thirst for conquest.
xln115.title: Queen's Bay Soldier

xln116.flavor: One was spared to tell the gruesome tale.
xln116.title: Raiders' Wake

xln119.flavor: "This scum is barely worth the trouble."
xln119.title: Ruthless Knave

xln120.flavor: The Sanctum Seekers were the first of the knightly orders to cross the sea and are still the most zealous.
xln120.title: Sanctum Seeker

xln122.flavor: It flows like water over the forest floor, as deadly as the swiftest current.
xln122.title: Skittering Heartstopper

xln123.flavor: "They're so much more willing to parley once they're hanging from a boom by the ankle!"
xln123.title: Skulduggery

xln124.flavor: From the perpetual shadowsmoke that hung above the ship, a silent form emerged, lips curled with malice and anticipation.
xln124.title: Skymarch Bloodletter

xln125.flavor:
"What is this foul presence that defies the sun's cleansing rays?"
—Itzama the Crested
xln125.title: Spreading Rot

xln126.flavor: "Take my blood if you want. Just don't take my gold!"
xln126.title: Sword-Point Diplomacy

xln127.flavor: The clerics known as condemners punish those who do not recognize the righteous authority of the church.
xln127.title: Vanquish the Weak

xln128.flavor:
"He is ambitious. Tireless. And utterly ruthless. Ideal for the frontier."
—Viceroy Elia Sotonores, report to the queen
xln128.title: Vicious Conquistador

xln129.flavor: It wasn't long before the taverns of High and Dry were full of whispers about the new captain who could turn a person to stone with a glance.
xln129.title: Vraska's Contempt

xln130.flavor: When Captain Thorn adds a new ship to his fleet, he gives the crew a simple choice: follow me, or fall in the sea.
xln130.title: Walk the Plank

xln131.flavor: "Trust me. The reward's not worth it."
xln131.title: Wanted Scoundrels

xln132.flavor: Captain Angrath cares less about treasure than mayhem. If he can't leave Ixalan, he'll burn the plane down.
xln132.title: Angrath's Marauders

xln133.flavor:
"You don't tame a horncrest. You convince it that it's easier to destroy something else."
—Amautl, knight of Atzocan
xln133.title: Bonded Horncrest

xln135.flavor:
"Tilonalli's searing rays carry the spark of life's eventual destruction as all light fades."
—Chitlati, Lightning Rider
xln135.title: Burning Sun's Avatar

xln137.flavor: "We sail. We plunder. Then we dance."
xln137.title: Captivating Crew

xln138.flavor: "I knew I should have stayed with the boat. Always stay with the boat!"
xln138.title: Charging Monstrosaur

xln139.flavor: What took months for human hands to carve took just seconds for the dinosaur's tail to ruin.
xln139.title: Demolish

xln140.flavor: If you're in the way of a ceratops charge and you're made of mere flesh and bone, then you're not really in the way.
xln140.title: Dinosaur Stampede

xln141.flavor: "Through me the rage of Tilonalli burns twice as bright."
xln141.title: Dual Shot

xln142.flavor: As she charges into battle, her arcane tattoos stir and crawl like fiery serpents.
xln142.title: Fathom Fleet Firebrand

xln143.flavor: Wary of the ferocious dinosaurs, the Legion of Dusk built up the walls of their fort—just in time for the pirates to burn them down.
xln143.title: Fiery Cannonade

xln144.flavor: Though grimed with the dust of centuries, the ancient shrine was not unguarded.
xln144.title: Fire Shrine Keeper

xln145.flavor: Goblins' fearlessness and diminutive size make them the perfect cannoneers.
xln145.title: Firecannon Blast

xln146.flavor: Sun Empire warriors are taught to emulate the fearless raptors that fling themselves against towers of horn and muscle a hundred times their size.
xln146.title: Frenzied Raptor

xln147.flavor:
"Watch your backs, keep your blades at hand, and let the orc go first!"
—Captain Brandis Thorn
xln147.title: Headstrong Brute

xln148.flavor: Trapped on Ixalan, the Planeswalker Angrath is the only minotaur sailing the seas. No matter how many ships he captures, he cannot break free.
xln148.title: Hijack

xln149.flavor:
"Storm on the horizon, cap'n!"
—Grick Doobin, last words
xln149.title: Lightning Strike

xln150.flavor: A pirate ship in battle is a storm of activity.
xln150.title: Lightning-Rig Crew

xln151.flavor: "Grease up a firecannon good and proper with dinosaur-liver oil, and it'll shoot just about anything."
xln151.title: Makeshift Munitions

xln152.flavor:
"These sailors on our shores are like the dinosaurs that plunder eggs from nests. They live on the labors of others."
—Itzama the Crested
xln152.title: Nest Robber

xln153.flavor: "Forward! Let the Burning Sun's light guide you to deserving prey!"
xln153.title: Otepec Huntmaster

xln154.flavor: All raptors are aggressive, but ferocidons seem to enjoy their prey's pain.
xln154.title: Rampaging Ferocidon

xln155.flavor:
"Every little hatchling has a parent's claws to guard it."
—Sun Empire saying
xln155.title: Raptor Hatchling

xln157.flavor: The hook makes him feel brave, and the hat makes him feel fancy.
xln157.title: Rigging Runner

xln158.flavor: The enormous can still be at the mercy of the small.
xln158.title: Rile

xln160.flavor: Goblins' eager curiosity leads them to scavenging, petty theft, and the rigging of sleek pirate ships. Some stop at scavenging.
xln160.title: Rummaging Goblin

xln161.flavor:
"The visions haunt me. I see the end of the world, brought on by the search for the Immortal Sun."
—Shaper Pashona
xln161.title: Star of Extinction

xln162.flavor: "Go ahead, build another. I'll burn that down as well."
xln162.title: Storm Fleet Arsonist

xln164.flavor: One alone is dangerous, and they are never alone.
xln164.title: Sun-Crowned Hunters

xln167.flavor: The pirates of the Brazen Coalition are the descendants of those displaced by the Legion of Dusk, and they are eager for vengeance.
xln167.title: Swashbuckling

xln168.flavor: They glide through the undergrowth, drawn to sounds of disturbance. They attack in unison and all share in the kill. And then they move on.
xln168.title: Thrash of Raptors

xln169.flavor: The people of the Sun Empire worship the sun in three aspects. Tilonalli is the Burning Sun, associated with ferocity, fire, and passion.
xln169.title: Tilonalli's Knight

xln170.flavor: "I am the ferocity of the Burning Sun. I am hide and feather, fang and claw."
xln170.title: Tilonalli's Skinshifter

xln172.flavor: Disputes within the Brazen Coalition can escalate from insult to broadside in the blink of an eye.
xln172.title: Unfriendly Fire

xln173.flavor: Now instead of a ship, Ripley Vance commands a fortress.
xln173.title: Spitfire Bastion

xln174.flavor: Goblins climb and swing with ease, whether through a pirate ship's rigging or a tree's branches.
xln174.title: Wily Goblin

xln175.flavor: It is taller than all but the tallest trees, and older than all but the oldest.
xln175.title: Ancient Brontodon

xln176.flavor: His arrows are fletched with feathers from the greatest of the winged dinosaurs.
xln176.title: Atzocan Archer

xln177.flavor: "I see you, shiny soldiers, but you won't see me."
xln177.title: Blinding Fog

xln178.flavor: The only force on Ixalan not interested in finding the golden city is Ixalan itself.
xln178.title: Blossom Dryad

xln179.flavor: Sun Empire commanders are well versed in advanced martial strategy. Still, the correct maneuver is usually to deploy the giant, implacable death lizard.
xln179.title: Carnage Tyrant

xln180.flavor: If you feel the ground quake, run. If you hear its bellow, flee. If you see its teeth, it's too late.
xln180.title: Colossal Dreadmaw

xln182.flavor: The Legion's conquistadors could endure Ixalan's sun. Their forts could withstand a charging ceratops. But nothing can stop a ceratops strengthened by the sun.
xln182.title: Crash the Ramparts

xln183.flavor:
"Do not mistake your lofty vantage point for safety."
—Shaper Tuvasa
xln183.title: Crushing Canopy

xln185.flavor: "No good will come from what you seek. Turn back now or suffer an ignoble death far from your home."
xln185.title: Deeproot Champion

xln186.flavor:
"We breathe from our soul and bones to give strength to the jungle. The jungle breathes from its roots and rivers to give strength to us."
—Shaper Falani
xln186.title: Deeproot Warrior

xln187.flavor: "I do not lead. They do not follow. We walk together."
xln187.title: Drover of the Mighty

xln188.flavor: "By accepting my smallness I am vast."
xln188.title: Emergent Growth

xln190.flavor: Often found browsing on the upper canopies of Ixalan's jungles, whiptails are known to absently bat away anything foolish enough to interrupt their meal.
xln190.title: Grazing Whiptail

xln191.flavor: Before the Sun Empire was born, humans and merfolk joined their magic to invoke a blessing of fertility on the land.
xln191.title: Itlimoc, Cradle of the Sun

xln193.flavor: The people of the Sun Empire worship the sun in three aspects. Ixalli is the Verdant Sun, who fosters growth in all things.
xln193.title: Ixalli's Keeper

xln194.flavor: The River Heralds believe that jade gives weight to their magic.
xln194.title: Jade Guardian

xln195.flavor: "There is no power too great to be used in the defense of our ancestral lands."
xln195.title: Jungle Delver

xln196.flavor: "The same power that drives the river ever onward flows through the roots and branches—to me."
xln196.title: Kumena's Speaker

xln199.flavor: "The jungle was here before any city. It will be here after the last city falls."
xln199.title: Old-Growth Dryads

xln200.flavor: The drive to hunt and feed is raw instinct for dinosaurs. The trick is simply to channel it in the right direction.
xln200.title: Pounce

xln201.flavor: They cover their territory like a tide of teeth and claws.
xln201.title: Ranging Raptors

xln202.flavor: A daggertooth's triumphant roar makes all the sounds of jungle life fall silent.
xln202.title: Ravenous Daggertooth

xln203.flavor: Raptors are clever enough to tear away a hard metal shell to get at the tasty morsel inside.
xln203.title: Ripjaw Raptor

xln204.flavor: "We are kin to the trees, and their strength is our own."
xln204.title: River Heralds' Boon

xln206.flavor: Protection is woven into every vine and branch.
xln206.title: Shapers' Sanctuary

xln207.flavor: The magic of the River Heralds is so great that even a single shaman can fend off a pirate landing party.
xln207.title: Slice in Twain

xln208.flavor: Lurking beneath the murky waters of Ixalan's rivers, sailbacks can rip a meal off the shore in the blink of an eye.
xln208.title: Snapping Sailback

xln209.flavor: The conquistadors surrounded the dinosaur only to find that it had outflanked them.
xln209.title: Spike-Tailed Ceratops

xln210.flavor:
"It appears that nature has risen against us."
—Captain Brinely Rage
xln210.title: Thundering Spineback

xln212.flavor: The dryads of the forest have no stake in Ixalan's conflict, but they hate to see any living being suffer.
xln212.title: Verdant Rebirth

xln213.flavor:
"Ixalli's fertile rays enliven us all. Each of us is a testament to the sun's strength and love."
—Chitlati, Lightning Rider
xln213.title: Verdant Sun's Avatar

xln214.flavor: She has never touched a loom, yet the tapestries she weaves are vast and beautiful.
xln214.title: Vineshaper Mystic

xln215.flavor: "Our foes are many and mighty, but not as many as the trees or as mighty as the sea."
xln215.title: Waker of the Wilds

xln216.flavor:
"Hear me, stone, root, branch: be the fist of this land. Turn back those who trample upon your domain."
—Song of the Shaper
xln216.title: Wildgrowth Walker

xln217.flavor: "You and your ship will make a fine addition to my fleet."
xln217.title: Admiral Beckett Brass

xln218.flavor: Predators try to separate the young, old, or injured from the rest of the herd. The alternative is crushing defeat.
xln218.title: Belligerent Brontodon

xln219.flavor: By the law of church and crown, vampires feed only on the blood of the guilty—those declared heretics, rebels, or enemies of war.
xln219.title: Call to the Feast

xln220.flavor: "Keep your friends close and your enemies within range."
xln220.title: Deadeye Plunderers

xln221.flavor: Orcs are happiest under captains who steer toward battle. Orcs of the Dire Fleet are downright jovial.
xln221.title: Dire Fleet Captain

xln226.flavor: Carnivorous dinosaurs developed a taste for undead flesh, tracking the vampires by the scent of blood on their breath.
xln226.title: Raging Swordtooth

xln227.flavor:
"Seeing a pack of these monsters hunt together, I'm at a loss to imagine the size of their prey."
—Adrian Adanto of Lujio
xln227.title: Regisaur Alpha

xln228.flavor: Shapers adapt nature to fit their needs and then return it to the way it was, leaving no trace of their passing.
xln228.title: Shapers of Nature

xln229.flavor:
"Wherever the Threefold Sun shines, great wings may go."
—Emperor Apatzec Intli III
xln229.title: Sky Terror

xln231.flavor: "For four hundred years, I have led armies of conquest. These lands hold nothing that can stand against me."
xln231.title: Vona, Butcher of Magan

xln235.flavor: The pirates had ventured into the interior for treasure. They found something far greater.
xln235.title: Lost Vale

xln236.flavor: It loomed up over the horizon, silent and dark as a grave.
xln236.title: Dusk Legion Dreadnought

xln239.flavor: The River Heralds fight to keep all others from reaching the golden city. The city has its own defenses.
xln239.title: Gilded Sentinel

xln240.flavor: In the Rite of Redemption, nobles take the same vows as Elenda, the first vampire, and make the same eternal sacrifice.
xln240.title: Hierophant's Chalice

xln247.flavor: The pirates had left the open sea behind, but they were still in their element: reckless adventure.
xln247.title: Sleek Schooner

xln250.flavor: Half the treasure is the glory of finding it.
xln250.title: Treasure Cove

xln252.flavor: When the Planeswalker Angrath called dinosaurs "dragons," the name stuck in certain pirate circles.
xln252.title: Dragonskull Summit

xln253.flavor: None can tell how many vessels are tangled up on the sea floor—or how much treasure remains unclaimed.
xln253.title: Drowned Catacomb

xln255.flavor: Ships blown north in their voyage across the Stormwreck Sea become trapped in the unmelting ice.
xln255.title: Glacial Fortress

xln256.flavor: Cliffs echo and branches quake at the roar of life.
xln256.title: Rootbound Crag

xln257.flavor: To the Sun Empire, any place where daylight brightens the jungle floor is sacred ground.
xln257.title: Sunpetal Grove

xln259.flavor:
"Just imagine what's waiting around the bend. Adventure. Discovery. Riches for the taking. This is why I sail."
—Captain Lannery Storm
xln259.title: Unknown Shores

xln283.flavor: "We drove the Sun Empire out of the forest long ago, and we will not let them return."
xln283.title: Jace's Sentinel

xln284.flavor: Countless streams flow into the nine rivers, and the nine rivers flow into the Great River. The River Heralds guard them all.
xln284.title: Woodland Stream

xln286.flavor: Don't make the mistake of thinking blunt horns can't kill.
xln286.title: Huatli's Snubhorn

xln287.flavor: "Run like the wind, fierce one. The hunt has begun."
xln287.title: Huatli's Spurring

xln288.flavor: When Huatli chooses a mount, its eyes glow with the flames of the sun.
xln288.title: Sun-Blessed Mount

xln289.flavor: The Sun Empire's cities are built from the bones of the earth.
xln289.title: Stone Quarry

rix3.flavor:
"No shadow remains for you to hide in."
—Caparocti Sunborn
rix3.title: Blazing Hope

rix4.flavor:
"The sun creates, sustains, and consumes so it can create again."
—Caparocti Sunborn
rix4.title: Cleansing Ray

rix5.flavor: Cunning warriors and dim-witted beasts alike fall under the church's harsh judgment.
rix5.title: Divine Verdict

rix6.flavor:
"Undefeated in battle, she is the shining future our empire deserves."
—Huatli
rix6.title: Everdawn Champion

rix7.flavor: "We have come at last to this holiest of holy places. What was stolen from us long ago is ours once again."
rix7.title: Exultant Skymarcher

rix8.flavor: Loyal to his queen, slave to his thirst.
rix8.title: Famished Paladin

rix10.flavor:
"The music of blades against its silver armor merely inspires it to bellow more full-throated melodies."
—Huatli
rix10.title: Imperial Ceratops

rix11.flavor: The Legion of Dusk sailed from Torrezon in search of glory, riches, and the Immortal Sun.
rix11.title: Legion Conquistador

rix12.flavor: "Your part in this fight is done, vampire. Get used to your thirst."
rix12.title: Luminous Bonds

rix13.flavor:
"Its rise is like the sun's, a beautiful beginning. Its descent is like the sun's, a frightful ending."
—Huatli
rix13.title: Majestic Heliopterus

rix14.flavor: "Should I fall, take up our standard and carry on. The Legion must always prevail."
rix14.title: Martyr of Dusk

rix15.flavor: "The time of salvation is at hand. Dusk washes over the world, and the Legion will rise immortal!"
rix15.title: Moment of Triumph

rix16.flavor: For every wound there is a blessing; for every death, a reckoning.
rix16.title: Paladin of Atonement

rix19.flavor: The abundance of foes in Orazca means the raptors no longer need any orders.
rix19.title: Raptor Companion

rix20.flavor: For the Legion of Dusk, the Immortal Sun is a source of eternal life. When they reclaim it, they will no longer be forced to subsist on the blood of the wicked.
rix20.title: Sanguine Glorifier

rix22.flavor:
"Cut the beasts out from under them and their strength is nothing."
—Vona of Iedo, Butcher of Magan
rix22.title: Slaughter the Strong

rix23.flavor: They're fun to train—if you like stubborn, aggressive, and fiercely territorial.
rix23.title: Snubhorn Sentry

rix26.flavor: "I will not sleep until Orazca is ours once more."
rix26.title: Sun Sentinel

rix27.flavor:
"Pterodons tolerate no intrusion into their skies. Even the clouds must ask permission."
—Mahuiz, Sun Empire archer
rix27.title: Sun-Crested Pterodon

rix28.flavor:
"Kinjalli sculpted humans from clay, but the dinosaurs were carved from unyielding stone."
—Itzama the Crested
rix28.title: Temple Altisaur

rix29.flavor:
"I would advise you not to struggle."
—Huatli
rix29.title: Trapjaw Tyrant

rix30.flavor: The sky takes flight and the earth trembles.
rix30.title: Zetalpa, Primal Dawn

rix33.flavor: Possession is eleven-tenths of the pirate code.
rix33.title: Crafty Cutpurse

rix38.flavor: Jace tumbled down the waterfall and plunged deep into his past.
rix38.title: Flood of Recollection

rix39.flavor: Being a merciful pirate, she saved the vampire's gold from falling overboard.
rix39.title: Hornswoggle

rix41.flavor: "Why perch in the crow's nest when I can fly like the crows?"
rix41.title: Kitesail Corsair

rix43.flavor: With matchless stealth, the River Heralds fought a running battle against the three enemy forces.
rix43.title: Mist-Cloaked Herald

rix44.flavor: "As one, nature lifts its voice to tell you this: ‘No.'"
rix44.title: Negate

rix46.flavor: "Here and gone like a fleeting breeze."
rix46.title: Release to the Wind

rix48.flavor: "Time flows as the rivers do, toward an unknown sea. The wise know to look downstream."
rix48.title: Riverwise Augur

rix49.flavor: The rising tide of Orazca's plunder lifted all ships.
rix49.title: Sailor of Means

rix50.flavor: "When the waves pick up, either you find your feet or you lose your lunch."
rix50.title: Sea Legs

rix51.flavor: Where the light falls dim and blue on broken ships, secrets lie unclaimed.
rix51.title: Seafloor Oracle

rix52.flavor: Stolen knowledge can never be stolen back.
rix52.title: Secrets of the Golden City

rix53.flavor: "If you keep to the shallows, you'll never learn the secrets of the depths."
rix53.title: Silvergill Adept

rix55.flavor: "I'd rather be caught red-handed than leave empty-handed!"
rix55.title: Slippery Scoundrel

rix56.flavor: With Kumena in control of the Immortal Sun, the rapids rose from their riverbeds and the waterfalls took flight.
rix56.title: Soul of the Rapids

rix58.flavor: For the River Heralds, the Immortal Sun is an object of terror and devastation. The idea that anyone would retrieve it for their own use is utterly abhorrent.
rix58.title: Sworn Guardian

rix62.flavor: "It is impious to admit, but I do enjoy pirate blood. Something in the salty tang of it, the spice of rebellion."
rix62.title: Arterial Flow

rix63.flavor: The first goblin tried to swim the canal. The second built a raft. The last and craftiest goblin launched herself from a firecannon and soared over the canal, trailing smoke. All were eaten, but only one was cooked.
rix63.title: Canal Monitor

rix64.flavor: "Drench these golden streets in the blood of our enemies."
rix64.title: Champion of Dusk

rix65.flavor: "Your mind is no longer yours to waste."
rix65.title: Dark Inquiry

rix67.flavor: "Aye, the foul beast chomped me, but I got away. You'd best believe when I find it again, it won't get away so easy."
rix67.title: Dinosaur Hunter

rix69.flavor: Stories say demon blood runs in its veins, making it fearless and bloodthirsty.
rix69.title: Dusk Charger

rix70.flavor: Once they reached Orazca, the Legion's explorers ransacked tombs and temples, hunting for the Immortal Sun.
rix70.title: Dusk Legion Zealot

rix71.flavor: Without frequent raids, orcs sometimes get bored and plunder their own ships.
rix71.title: Fathom Fleet Boarder

rix74.flavor: "I can hear the plunder calling. It asks for me by name."
rix74.title: Grasping Scoundrel

rix75.flavor:
"You were keen enough to sink your fangs into us, vampire! And now you're afraid of a few little nibbles?"
—Udvil "Ratty" Ratlock
rix75.title: Gruesome Fate

rix76.flavor: Never let the glitter of gold distract you from the gleam of steel in the shadows.
rix76.title: Impale

rix77.flavor: Another piece of a nefarious puzzle.
rix77.title: Mastermind's Acquisition

rix79.flavor: "The time of condemnation is at hand. Dusk washes over the world, and I consign you to eternal darkness!"
rix79.title: Moment of Craving

rix80.flavor:
"My conquistadors are never slain, merely laid to rest."
—Queen Miralda the Pious
rix80.title: Oathsworn Vampire

rix81.flavor: "Shame to let good gold go to the grave."
rix81.title: Pitiless Plunderer

rix82.flavor: Opening Orazca unleashed more horrors than just the Immortal Sun.
rix82.title: Ravenous Chupacabra

rix83.flavor: Onora knew with sudden, grim certainty he would never see the Great River again.
rix83.title: Reaver Ambush

rix84.flavor:
"No more fear of death's oblivion—is this not the greatest treasure of all?"
—Gurezan, Legion resurrectionist
rix84.title: Recover

rix85.flavor: "I will catch you, child of the sun. I will drink your life and leave you a husk, discarded in the shadows."
rix85.title: Sadistic Skymarcher

rix89.flavor:
"A thick fog obscures the port of Leor, but it's not thick enough to muffle the screams."
—Admiral Beckett Brass
rix89.title: Vampire Revenant

rix91.flavor: The purest devotion isn't the Blood Fast itself, but the craving that follows.
rix91.title: Voracious Vampire

rix92.flavor: As the struggle raged for control of the Immortal Sun, the world grew dark under a blood-red sky.
rix92.title: Blood Sun

rix93.flavor:
"Want to sink a ship? Blow a hole in the hull. Want to kill a regisaur? Same answer."
—Captain Brandis Thorn
rix93.title: Bombard

rix94.flavor:
"Why squabble for trinkets when we could be living large off all this gold?"
—Admiral Beckett Brass
rix94.title: Brass's Bounty

rix96.flavor: Never underestimate the power of panache.
rix96.title: Buccaneer's Bravado

rix97.flavor: It doesn't hold grudges. It runs them down and impales them.
rix97.title: Charging Tuskodon

rix98.flavor: No ancient lore ties the pirates of the Brazen Coalition to the Immortal Sun. But it's a powerful ancient artifact in a city of gold—what's not to covet?
rix98.title: Daring Buccaneer

rix100.flavor: The storm rages and the earth breaks.
rix100.title: Etali, Primal Storm

rix101.flavor:
"The Brazen Coalition is a firecannon pointed at our enemies. Goblins like him are the spark to its powder."
—Admiral Beckett Brass
rix101.title: Fanatical Firebrand

rix104.flavor: Nothing says trouble like a reedy hiss with a hint of liquid gurgle.
rix104.title: Frilled Deathspitter

rix105.flavor: "Why are we following the goblin? Can he even read that map?" —Daphne Vail, Diremore first mate
rix105.title: Goblin Trailblazer

rix106.flavor: Pirate captains rarely enjoy a peaceful retirement.
rix106.title: Mutiny

rix107.flavor: It hatches with its ferocity fully grown.
rix107.title: Needletooth Raptor

rix108.flavor:
"If you come across a raptor in the city, stay perfectly still. At least then you'll be well rested when you die."
—Captain Brandis Thorn
rix108.title: Orazca Raptor

rix109.flavor: Goblins can carry their body weight in loot.
rix109.title: Pirate's Pillage

rix110.flavor: "Hard to starboard! Starb— Abandon ship! Abandon ship!"
rix110.title: Reckless Rage

rix113.flavor: A threefold calamity with a single will.
rix113.title: Shake the Foundations

rix114.flavor: Today it's a miracle of architecture, a marvel of stained glass, a symbol of the Legion's power. Tomorrow, driftwood.
rix114.title: Shatter

rix115.flavor:
"Control them? No. I gird them in armor and let them loose."
—Yacha, Otepec huntmaster
rix115.title: Silverclad Ferocidons

rix116.flavor: When the golden city opened, the dinosaurs inside were eager to greet the new visitors.
rix116.title: Stampeding Horncrest

rix117.flavor: "A bolt to the eye, a blade to the neck. That's the way to clear the deck!"
rix117.title: Storm Fleet Swashbuckler

rix118.flavor:
"With Tilonalli's gifts, even the smallest of us can become great."
—Huatli
rix118.title: Sun-Collared Raptor

rix119.flavor: "I'm about to make you famous. From the golden city to High and Dry, they'll talk about how fast you died!"
rix119.title: Swaggering Corsair

rix122.flavor: "Our lives, our homes, and all our history are at risk. Do not speak to me of peace."
rix122.title: Aggressive Urge

rix123.flavor: When a cacophodon is angry, the whole jungle knows.
rix123.title: Cacophodon

rix124.flavor: Despite its appearance, it's anything but defenseless.
rix124.title: Cherished Hatchling

rix125.flavor:
"Remember when it was the most terrifying thing you'd ever seen?"
—Captain Lannery Storm
rix125.title: Colossal Dreadmaw

rix126.flavor:
"Our survival, like theirs, depends on our ability to work together."
—Huatli, to Tishana
rix126.title: Crested Herdcaller

rix127.flavor: "You think I stand alone? I have the forest at my call, the waters at my back. I outnumber you."
rix127.title: Deeproot Elite

rix131.flavor: "The only gold I need is the sheltering shimmer of the trees."
rix131.title: Giltgrove Stalker

rix132.flavor: For the Sun Empire, the Immortal Sun is a symbol of national identity. When they reclaim it, the Empire will flourish once more.
rix132.title: Hardy Veteran

rix133.flavor:
"Death lizard approaching, cap'n!"
—Brint Doobin, last words
rix133.title: Hunt the Weak

rix134.flavor: "Sisora wore this, who defeated the tyrant of Azcanta, and before her Natena of Vuhana's band. May it bring you their strength."
rix134.title: Jade Bearer

rix135.flavor: "A blade is not fully forged until it is given."
rix135.title: Jadecraft Artisan

rix137.flavor: "We fought so long to hide this place. Let us be first to learn its wonders!"
rix137.title: Jungleborn Pioneer

rix139.flavor:
"Better to let the sword go than to lose the arm with it."
—Captain Lannery Storm
rix139.title: Naturalize

rix140.flavor: The frillbacks of Orazca soak up the sun on their tall spinal fins. They look slow and sleepy—until they catch the scent of prey.
rix140.title: Orazca Frillback

rix141.flavor: It embodies the riotous growth of the jungle, where creatures crowd upon creatures, where roots sprawl and vines swarm.
rix141.title: Overgrown Armasaur

rix143.flavor:
"Still, the pterodon chasing the clouds from its skies must bow to the great forest below."
—Mahuiz, Sun Empire archer
rix143.title: Plummet

rix144.flavor: An innumerable pack is concealed in a single reflection.
rix144.title: Polyraptor

rix145.flavor: The pack that ambushes, eviscerates, and devours together stays together.
rix145.title: Strength of the Pack

rix146.flavor: A warning shout would take too long.
rix146.title: Swift Warden

rix148.flavor: It cares more about preserving the herd's territory than about preserving itself.
rix148.title: Thrashing Brontodon

rix149.flavor: The herds follow as new growth arises.
rix149.title: Thunderherd Migration

rix151.flavor: "The Great River will not be tamed."
rix151.title: World Shaper

rix153.flavor: Streams of gold and bright feathers flash in the orb, visions of past and future.
rix153.title: Atzocan Seer

rix156.flavor: The buccaneers scaled the sides of buildings as easily as they boarded enemy ships.
rix156.title: Dire Fleet Neckbreaker

rix160.flavor: . . . but every end is a new beginning.
rix160.title: Atzal, Cave of Eternity

rix161.flavor:
"You cannot kill it, not for long. It ripens where the ground is soaked with the blood of the slaughtered."
—Atiuru, priest of the Verdant Sun
rix161.title: Jungle Creeper

rix163.flavor: "We long ago abandoned the things that make humans weak: friendship, marriage, family. All that remains is the strength of our devotion."
rix163.title: Legion Lieutenant

rix164.flavor:
"The mist clothes us when we are bare, hides us when we are alone, and unites us when we are together."
—Nirit of Pashona's band
rix164.title: Merfolk Mistbinder

rix166.flavor: . . . resting in the splendor of the dead.
rix166.title: Tomb of the Dusk Rose

rix167.flavor: Imitation is the sincerest form of piracy.
rix167.title: Protean Raider

rix168.flavor: Its breath is a gale. Its roar is a volcano. Its anger tears soul from flesh.
rix168.title: Raging Regisaur

rix169.flavor: As the battle for Orazca unfolded, the contenders discovered that others had already staked a claim.
rix169.title: Relentless Raptor

rix171.flavor: To a siegehorn, there is no such thing as a dead end.
rix171.title: Siegehorn Ceratops

rix172.flavor:
"Charge like a red-hot cannonball straight to your target. You slow down, you sink."
—Captain Lannery Storm
rix172.title: Storm Fleet Sprinter

rix173.flavor: Swimming in coins proved harder than they'd hoped, but dancing was a jingling delight.
rix173.title: Vault of Catlacan

rix176.flavor: As soon as Jace laid eyes on the great sphinx's chamber, the shards of memory began sliding into place.
rix176.title: Sanctum of the Sun

rix178.flavor:
"Gold without freedom might as well be lead."
—Angrath
rix178.title: Gleaming Barrier

rix179.flavor: An army of living gold for the golden city.
rix179.title: Gold-Forge Garrison

rix182.flavor: Made to ward off the Grim Captain and silence the lure of undeath.
rix182.title: Silent Gravestone

rix183.flavor:
"Because the giant, implacable death lizard wasn't scary enough already."
—Captain Brinely Rage
rix183.title: Strider Harness

rix184.flavor:
"The best kind of treasure is the kind that leads to more treasure!"
—Captain Lannery Storm
rix184.title: Traveler's Amulet

rix186.flavor: The Sun Empire bends nature—rivers, mountainsides, dinosaurs—to its unyielding will.
rix186.title: Evolving Wilds

rix187.flavor: In the galleon's grand cathedral, conquistadors swore vows of faith. In its wreckage, they swore vows of revenge.
rix187.title: Forsaken Sanctuary

rix188.flavor: The stench of rotting meat lures flies, goblins, and young raptors.
rix188.title: Foul Orchard

rix189.flavor:
"A place like this makes me wonder if there's more to life than blood and treasure . . . Nah."
—Boyl Bucksalt, Storm Fleet swab
rix189.title: Highland Lake

rix190.flavor: The Sun Empire's cities are built from the bones of the earth.
rix190.title: Stone Quarry

rix191.flavor: Countless streams flow into the nine rivers, and the nine rivers flow into the Great River. The River Heralds guard them all.
rix191.title: Woodland Stream

rix198.flavor: "These pirates must answer for their ancestors, who renounced the Church of Dusk and sailed from Torrezon as heretics."
rix198.title: Vampire Champion

rix199.flavor: Abandoning both queen and church, he chose to follow power.
rix199.title: Vraska's Conquistador

rix202.flavor: Orcs have been enemies of the Legion of Dusk since it was formed, and the entire race has been declared anathema.
rix202.title: Angrath's Ambusher

rix203.flavor: Though small, goblins can hold their own in a fight. Foolhardy confidence goes a long way.
rix203.title: Swab Goblin

rix205.flavor:
"Burn their fleet to the waterline, and sink whatever's left."
—Angrath
rix205.title: Cinder Barrens

dar2.flavor: The shield took a year to craft, a month to enchant, and a decade to master—all for one glorious moment.
dar2.title: Adamant Will

dar3.flavor: "My flock flew from a distant continent ruined by cataclysm and war. Benalia gave us shelter to end our exodus."
dar3.title: Aven Sentry

dar4.flavor: "The walls of Argive were built by a peaceful dynastic union that has guarded us against war for fifteen centuries. The lesson is clear."
dar4.title: Baird, Steward of Argive

dar5.flavor: "The true measure of all heroes is not what they achieve, but who they inspire." —Triumph of Gerrard
dar5.title: Benalish Honor Guard

dar6.flavor: "Some aspire to climb the mountain of Honor. The Benalish are born upon its peak, and from there ascend among the stars." —History of Benalia
dar6.title: Benalish Marshal

dar7.flavor: Enchanted by mage-smiths and blessed by priests, Benalish windows let in light and cast out darkness.
dar7.title: Blessed Light

dar8.flavor: A new gathering for a new age.
dar8.title: Board the Weatherlight

dar9.flavor: Benalish citizens born under the same constellations share a star-clan. Their loyalty to one another interlaces the Seven Houses.
dar9.title: Call the Cavalry

dar10.flavor:
"Honor rides before us. All we have to do is catch up."
—Danitha Capashen
dar10.title: Charge

dar11.flavor:
"Go swiftly, clever arrow, and teach
The philosophy of stillness."
—D'Avenant verse
dar11.title: D'Avenant Trapper

dar12.flavor: "I will protect the less fortunate. I will love bravely. I will face despair and fight on. As a Capashen, I can do no less."
dar12.title: Danitha Capashen, Paragon

dar14.flavor: The Benalish aristocracy is hereditary, but the loyalty of its subjects is earned.
dar14.title: Dauntless Bodyguard

dar16.flavor: "Light from the Null Moon took form—a mirage made real, alone in grandeur, isolated in a world that once had been its own." —Fall of the Thran
dar16.title: Evra, Halcyon Witness

dar19.flavor: On Amonkhet, Gideon lost both his sural and his faith in himself. But he can still throw a punch, and he still knows a bad guy when he sees one.
dar19.title: Gideon's Reproach

dar20.flavor:
"Whatever faith you have in Serra, she has more in you."
—Lyra Dawnbringer
dar20.title: Healing Grace

dar22.flavor: "Let go of all that harms you. Cast your burdens into the darkness, and build for the faithful a house of light." —Song of All, canto 1008
dar22.title: Invoke the Divine

dar23.flavor: A light to pierce the shadows.
dar23.title: Knight of Grace

dar24.flavor: The mage-smiths of New Benalia have perfected the art of blending fine steel and enchanted glass into weapons that are both beautiful and deadly. Only elite knights are entrusted with these martial works of art.
dar24.title: Knight of New Benalia

dar25.flavor: Descendant of a vanished land, student of a forgotten general, and master of blades no smith could forge anew. He honors them all by living a life worthy of song.
dar25.title: Kwende, Pride of Femeref

dar26.flavor: "You are not alone. You never were."
dar26.title: Lyra Dawnbringer

dar27.flavor: The unicorns of Sursi are a manifestation of Serra's joy and compassion. They frolic and dance like children, offering blessings to anyone they encounter.
dar27.title: Mesa Unicorn

dar28.flavor: "The spirit of Serra raised Brindri high and commanded her to keep the balance." —Song of All, canto 524
dar28.title: On Serra's Wings

dar29.flavor: A pegasus chooses its rider, bearing the worthy into the clouds and tossing all others to the ground.
dar29.title: Pegasus Courser

dar30.flavor:
"When history becomes too mournful, even good souls may choose to forget."
—Shalai, voice of Plenty
dar30.title: Sanctum Spirit

dar31.flavor: An ancient nemesis rendered harmless long ago.
dar31.title: Seal Away

dar32.flavor: Knights get the glory. Soldiers get things done.
dar32.title: Sergeant-at-Arms

dar33.flavor: The angel remembers her past lives like dreams. Her song held up meadows. Her blade drove back darkness. Her wings carried her across the ages.
dar33.title: Serra Angel

dar34.flavor: Theologians now believe the Ancestor was another divine form of Serra.
dar34.title: Serra Disciple

dar36.flavor: "The Ancestor saved us for a purpose."
dar36.title: Teshar, Ancestor's Apostle

dar37.flavor: "In a healing world I write—I, who will never be healed. Let my last gift be one of memory: from a thousand lost thoughts, choose one, and remember my name."
dar37.title: Tragic Poet

dar39.flavor: Centuries ago, one man's vengeance plunged the world into ice and darkness.
dar39.title: Urza's Ruinous Blast

dar41.flavor: "We don't choose who comes here. We choose how long they stay."
dar41.title: Academy Journeymage

dar43.flavor: The Tolarian Academies are known for their magical research, powerful sorcerers, and accidental destruction of ecosystems.
dar43.title: Arcane Flight

dar45.flavor:
"The trick to talking sense into Keldons is getting them to hold still. I learned that from Radha."
—Jhoira
dar45.title: Befuddle

dar48.flavor: For generations, the inhabitants of Orvada have hungered for turtle soup. For generations, the turtles have frustrated their ambitions.
dar48.title: Cold-Water Snapper

dar50.flavor: For cryomancers, studying the Ice Age isn't just an academic exercise.
dar50.title: Deep Freeze

dar51.flavor: Archaeologists don't just dig in the dirt. They excavate time, scraping off the years grain by grain.
dar51.title: Diligent Excavator

dar52.flavor:
"Half your studies will be learning the laws of magic. The other half will be bending them."
—Naru Meha, master wizard
dar52.title: Divination

dar53.flavor: "Homarids spread northward from Sarpadia as the climate cooled, raiding coastal settlements for supplies." —Time of Ice
dar53.title: Homarid Explorer

dar54.flavor:
"Your contract is in default. You belong to me now. Serve, or die."
—Nicol Bolas
dar54.title: In Bolas's Clutches

dar55.flavor: Centuries ago, a quest to harness time became a spiral into chaos.
dar55.title: Karn's Temporal Sundering

dar56.flavor: Saved from destruction by one planeswalker's sacrifice, the Eliterate colony forswore the taking of life.
dar56.title: Merfolk Trickster

dar60.flavor: The crystal pulsed with the power of Teferi's planeswalker spark. Had Jhoira given him a blessing or a curse?
dar60.title: Opt

dar62.flavor: Her knack for tampering with wards got her kicked out of the academy, but they also got her back in.
dar62.title: Relic Runner

dar63.flavor: With just a few seconds to escape, Deryan saved Hurkyl's editions on restoring physical objects from ash.
dar63.title: Rescue

dar64.flavor: Though it was laid to waste by the brothers, many schools of magic trace their origins to the College of Lat-Nam, including the first Tolarian Academy.
dar64.title: Sage of Lat-Nam

dar67.flavor: The fire spell stuttered and broke. Its pieces reached Teferi out of rhythm, meaningless.
dar67.title: Syncopate

dar68.flavor: The first to arrive on Dominaria from their distant home, the marids are the oldest tribe of djinn and the most respected by storm and sea.
dar68.title: Tempest Djinn

dar69.flavor: "My ancestor Toshiro used to say, ‘Life is a series of choices between bad and worse.' I'm a master of making great bad choices."
dar69.title: Tetsuko Umezawa, Fugitive

dar71.flavor: The Tolarian Academies embrace a tradition of study and research while discouraging the kinds of experiments that ruined the original island of Tolaria.
dar71.title: Tolarian Scholar

dar72.flavor:
"A problem is only a problem if you don't have the tools to correct it."
—Jhoira
dar72.title: Unwind

dar73.flavor: The Vodalian Empire tends to be insular. The scholarly Volshe caste are the exception, using education as an antidote to xenophobia.
dar73.title: Vodalian Arcanist

dar74.flavor: In lives that have stretched for centuries, there are bound to be a few awkward silences.
dar74.title: Weight of Memory

dar75.flavor:
"The second mage learned to dissipate blasts of lightning. Threat and response: thus did the study of magic progress."
—Naban, dean of iteration
dar75.title: Wizard's Retort

dar76.flavor: "I do as I please, little mortal. Do go on about your wishes, though—they amuse me to no end."
dar76.title: Zahid, Djinn of the Lamp

dar77.flavor:
"My heart is not mine, it is Belzenlok's. All hearts are his, and all blood."
—"Rite of Belzenlok"
dar77.title: Blessing of Belzenlok

dar78.flavor: "All hail the Demonlord Belzenlok, Evincar of the Stronghold, Scion of Darkness, Doom of Fools, Lord of the Wastes, Master of the Ebon Hand, Eternal Patriarch of the Cabal . . ."
dar78.title: Cabal Evangel

dar79.flavor:
"The Demonlord has ruled every age. Every ruin, myth, and nightmare proves his power."
—"Rite of Belzenlok"
dar79.title: Cabal Paladin

dar80.flavor: "Take their faces. The lips of these unbelievers may yet honor the Demonlord."
dar80.title: Caligo Skin-Witch

dar81.flavor: "Your life is finished, your name lost, and your work forgotten. It is as though Mazeura never existed." —Chainer's Torment
dar81.title: Cast Down

dar83.flavor: "I have pustules of the great Ratadrabik, very cheap. No? Surely you'll want a tincture of Nevinyrral's pulverized remains. Genuine!"
dar83.title: Dark Bargain

dar84.flavor:
"Nature is not always gentle or kind, but all life begets life."
—Marwyn of Llanowar
dar84.title: Deathbloom Thallid

dar85.flavor: In the Cabal, death is just another mark of devotion.
dar85.title: Demonic Vigor

dar87.flavor: Flittersprites collect unusually valuable things: coins of fallen empires, baby teeth, and memories of treasured names.
dar87.title: Divest

dar88.flavor:
"The forest surrounding the Vess estate became the Caligo Morass, a vast bog stalked by horrors too terrible to name."
—"The Fall of the House of Vess"
dar88.title: Dread Shade

dar89.flavor: The Cabal assured the Seven Houses that hostages receive all the food and rest they require.
dar89.title: Drudge Sentinel

dar91.flavor:
"Fear the dark if you must, but don't mistake sunlight for safety."
—Josu Vess
dar91.title: Eviscerate

dar92.flavor:
"Urborg used to be lovely—scenic volcanoes, respectable lich lords. Since the Cabal came with their nightmares and thrulls, it's all gone to the worms."
—Mister Lostspoons, Skulltown gossip
dar92.title: Feral Abomination

dar93.flavor:
"Sleep now, brother. That is the one gift I can give you."
—Liliana Vess
dar93.title: Final Parting

dar94.flavor: To thallids, the whole world is just a pile of mulch to grow saprolings in.
dar94.title: Fungal Infection

dar97.flavor: A shadow to swallow the light.
dar97.title: Knight of Malice

dar99.flavor: "True power never dies, but lies awake, waiting for its name to be spoken." —The Eldest Reborn
dar99.title: Lingering Phantom

dar101.flavor: Wreckage from the Phyrexian Invasion provided the rats with a seemingly unlimited number of breeding grounds.
dar101.title: Rat Colony

dar103.flavor:
"You bound me with a contract only your death could end—and you thought me the fool?"
—Liliana Vess
dar103.title: Settle the Score

dar104.flavor: The first mistake the Grimnant knights made was bullying the owner of an Urborg corpse shop. Their second mistake was dying.
dar104.title: Soul Salvage

dar106.flavor: Thelon of Havenwood created thallids as a food source in times of darkness. Thallids did the same with saprolings.
dar106.title: Thallid Omnivore

dar107.flavor: Some of the thallids that escaped into the fens of Urborg began emulating the Cabal's bloodsoaked rituals in their own peculiar way.
dar107.title: Thallid Soothsayer

dar109.flavor: As the phantom flies overhead, the city of Vhelnish screams in silence.
dar109.title: Urgoros, the Empty One

dar111.flavor: "Look how they beg for the knife! The Demonlord has trained them well."
dar111.title: Whisper, Blood Liturgist

dar112.flavor: Acolytes of the lost Lord Windgrace fight to keep Urborg relics out of Cabal hands.
dar112.title: Windgrace Acolyte

dar113.flavor: When Belzenlok's lieutenant Yar-Kul grew too ambitious, the Demonlord transformed him into a maggot. The frog that ate the maggot grew and grew, until a ravenous spirit burst from its body.
dar113.title: Yargle, Glutton of Urborg

dar114.flavor: Centuries ago, a mad god offered a simple trade.
dar114.title: Yawgmoth's Vile Offering

dar115.flavor: The stone whispers tales of darkness and fire. She replies, "Tell me more."
dar115.title: Bloodstone Goblin

dar116.flavor: Grand Warlord Radha's challengers are always defeated, but she rewards the most passionate with the Flame of Keld. After that, they burn for her.
dar116.title: Champion of the Flame

dar117.flavor:
"The flame paints a bright wheel on the sky, then shifts into a stabbing spark. The enemy falls; the smoke of victory rises."
—"Legends of the Firedancer"
dar117.title: Fervent Strike

dar118.flavor: Burning something is easy. Choosing a target can be more difficult.
dar118.title: Fiery Intervention

dar120.flavor:
"The best way to learn from a book on pyromancy is to burn it."
—Jaya Ballard
dar120.title: Fire Elemental

dar121.flavor: The versatile "fiery gauntlet" is among the first spells young Ghitu mages learn.
dar121.title: Firefist Adept

dar124.flavor:
"The heat in our hearts sometimes rises to the surface."
—Valduk, keeper of the Flame
dar124.title: Frenzied Rage

dar126.flavor: The Ghitu of Shiv are as fierce and uncompromising as their volcanic home.
dar126.title: Ghitu Journeymage

dar127.flavor: Tolarians teach the theory of pyromancy. The Ghitu prefer applied research.
dar127.title: Ghitu Lavarunner

dar129.flavor: "The trick is, once you get moving, don't stop!"
dar129.title: Goblin Chainwhirler

dar130.flavor: Not since the days of Pashalik Mons have the Rundvelt goblins been so united or effective.
dar130.title: Goblin Warchief

dar133.flavor: Centuries ago, a pyromancer's spark ignited a fiery conflagration.
dar133.title: Jaya's Immolating Inferno

dar135.flavor: Keldon raiders' spoils are limited to what their colos can carry. No matter the value, the rest goes up in smoke.
dar135.title: Keldon Raider

dar136.flavor:
"The Mountain gave the Flame to Kradak to light the furnaces of his people's hearts. The wanderers became Keldons, and he the first warlord."
—"The Flame of Keld"
dar136.title: Keldon Warcaller

dar137.flavor: Every ancient relic is a weapon if you throw it hard enough.
dar137.title: Orcish Vandal

dar138.flavor: As the Cabal legions pushed into Shiv, they learned not to stand so close together.
dar138.title: Radiating Lightning

dar139.flavor: Keldon warriors take advantage of the cyclops's inability to focus on more than one thing at a time.
dar139.title: Rampaging Cyclops

dar140.flavor: Keld faced an apocalypse to fulfill a dire prophecy. Now Keldons have nothing left to believe in except themselves.
dar140.title: Run Amok

dar141.flavor: "Shiv is a restless land. It heaves ash, bleeds lava, and scabs over in black obsidian." —The First Eruption
dar141.title: Seismic Shift

dar142.flavor: Sometimes Shivan dragons toy with their food. Other times they just cook it.
dar142.title: Shivan Fire

dar144.flavor: Deep beneath the ruined continent of Otaria, there's a mine where goblins still work, ignorant of the destruction above.
dar144.title: Skirk Prospector

dar145.flavor: It skitters across Shiv, each tendril hitting the ground with a sharp snap.
dar145.title: Skizzik

dar146.flavor: "You gotta be pretty smart to live long as me, but not being able to die helps."
dar146.title: Squee, the Immortal

dar147.flavor: He watches the pass in both directions, and all must pay his toll.
dar147.title: Two-Headed Giant

dar148.flavor: The hammer strikes. The Flame awakens.
dar148.title: Valduk, Keeper of the Flame

dar150.flavor: War begins with one red ember.
dar150.title: Warcry Phoenix

dar151.flavor:
"The old ways were for a winter world. We do what's best for us, not for the past. We are Keldons!"
—Grand Warlord Radha
dar151.title: Warlord's Fury

dar152.flavor:
"The study of magic began when the first mage taught herself to throw lightning."
—Naban, dean of iteration
dar152.title: Wizard's Lightning

dar153.flavor: Every odyssey begins with a single step.
dar153.title: Adventurous Impulse

dar154.flavor: Multani's mind grasped for consciousness as rage itself rebuilt his body.
dar154.title: Ancient Animus

dar155.flavor:
"Llanowar's boughs are ever ready
To unleash an autumn of steel leaves."
—"Song of Freyalise"
dar155.title: Arbor Armament

dar156.flavor: A baloth only cares about the many things it eats and the few things that eat it.
dar156.title: Baloth Gorger

dar157.flavor: "I can't bear to see another plane broken before I make my own home whole. I'm sorry, but my watch is over."
dar157.title: Broken Bond

dar158.flavor: Nothing tastes finer to an ooze than a priceless family heirloom.
dar158.title: Corrosive Ooze

dar159.flavor: The bond between Llanowar elves and their kavu empowers both.
dar159.title: Elfhame Druid

dar160.flavor: Thallids nurture saprolings, entertain them, and eat them.
dar160.title: Fungal Plots

dar162.flavor: Fallen Phyrexians were transmuted into elementals by Gaea long ago, but Yavimaya's other inhabitants still regard them with unease.
dar162.title: Gaea's Protector

dar166.flavor: Centuries ago, a barbarian laid his rage to rest.
dar166.title: Kamahl's Druidic Vow

dar167.flavor: "Druids endure disaster as seeds endure winter. Now Krosa blooms once more."
dar167.title: Krosan Druid

dar169.flavor: "Cherish this world in honor of the martyrs who saved it. We too must be prepared to give our lives." —The Mending of Dominaria
dar169.title: Llanowar Envoy

dar170.flavor: Llanowar elfhames occupy different heights within the great forest. Elves of the Loridalh and Kelfae hames can see neither earth nor sky.
dar170.title: Llanowar Scout

dar171.flavor: Most spiders of Llanowar disdain elvish alliances. No elf has as many beautiful eyes or as many strong arms.
dar171.title: Mammoth Spider

dar172.flavor: Midwife to mothers and leader to all.
dar172.title: Marwyn, the Nurturer

dar175.flavor: "As Argoth's last defenders fell to Urza's juggernauts, Titania said, ‘Nature cannot be destroyed, only changed.'" —The Antiquities War
dar175.title: Nature's Spiral

dar176.flavor: Llanowar elves conceal their ballistae in the upper canopy of the forest, ready to clear the skies of any intruder.
dar176.title: Pierce the Sky

dar177.flavor:
"You can hear its tail thrashing from a mile away. Keep in mind that its jaws may already be half a mile closer."
—Jenson Carthalion, Yavimaya exile
dar177.title: Primordial Wurm

dar178.flavor: Thallids herd saprolings from place to place in search of detritus to feed them.
dar178.title: Saproling Migration

dar180.flavor: As the irrepressible power of a dormant Multani courses through Yavimaya, the forest passes judgment on travelers and natives alike. Only the fungus prospers.
dar180.title: Spore Swarm

dar181.flavor: "The identifying ornamental growths of alpha thallids may be hereditary, or catalyzed by some chemical signal." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. III
dar181.title: Sporecrown Thallid

dar182.flavor: One eye open to see the truth of the world. One eye covered to gaze at the goddess within.
dar182.title: Steel Leaf Champion

dar183.flavor:
"Yavimaya is aware, but not always awake. You will know the difference when you see it."
—Karn
dar183.title: Sylvan Awakening

dar184.flavor: A living remnant of the Ice Age.
dar184.title: Territorial Allosaurus

dar185.flavor: The first law of Yavimaya is that guests may kill only to survive. As fires aren't needed in the warm weather, cutting trees for wood means death.
dar185.title: Thorn Elemental

dar187.flavor: The bower shuddered. The stillness broke. The scurf shifted, and a being emerged from the flowers and ferns.
dar187.title: Verdant Force

dar189.flavor: "When their community grows cluttered, thallids begin a traditional bobbing dance, then trek out in all directions." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. III
dar189.title: Yavimaya Sapherd

dar190.flavor: The passionate intensity of the Ghitu tempered by the cool insight of Tolarian training.
dar190.title: Adeliz, the Cinder Wind

dar191.flavor: "I won't abandon the Weatherlight. My destiny is to serve at Jhoira's side. This ‘illness' means I must trust my faith more and myself less."
dar191.title: Arvad the Cursed

dar195.flavor: "The future is my gift to Keld."
dar195.title: Grand Warlord Radha

dar197.flavor: As she took the wheel of the Weatherlight for the first time in a millennium, Jhoira knew she'd been right to restore the ship. Anything was possible now.
dar197.title: Jhoira, Weatherlight Captain

dar198.flavor:
"Chronicles across the ages describe Jodah. They likely refer not to one mage, but to a family or an arcane title."
—Arkol, Argivian scholar
dar198.title: Jodah, Archmage Eternal

dar199.flavor:
"My child grew from rot and ruin, yet she bloomed."
—Multani
dar199.title: Muldrotha, the Gravetide

dar200.flavor: "For the lost and forgotten, I will keep watch."
dar200.title: Oath of Teferi

dar201.flavor: Centuries ago, five dragons conquered death to rule the living.
dar201.title: Primevals' Glorious Rebirth

dar204.flavor: "I am heir to many treasures. None is as precious as knowing how my ancestor lived her life."
dar204.title: Shanna, Sisay's Legacy

dar205.flavor: As Jhoira restored the Weatherlight, a mushroom growing in its hold unexpectedly became her first crew member.
dar205.title: Slimefoot, the Stowaway

dar206.flavor: "Yavimaya is one being—one vastness of rippling leaves, one deepness of roots, and one chatter of animals—of which I am one part."
dar206.title: Tatyova, Benthic Druid

dar209.flavor: An ancient device recovered from a thawing glacier high in the Karplusan mountains.
dar209.title: Aesthir Glider

dar210.flavor: Neither its appearance nor its temperature varies as the years pass, an eternal testament to the forces that shaped Dominaria.
dar210.title: Amaranthine Wall

dar211.flavor: It spilled the blood of one elder dragon. In Gideon's hands, it may yet taste another's.
dar211.title: Blackblade Reforged

dar212.flavor:
"Bring me an angel feather, and I will give you one death in return. There can be no turning back once the candle is lit."
—Whisper, blood liturgist
dar212.title: Bloodtallow Candle

dar213.flavor: A Thran relic, it has spent ten thousand years doing absolutely nothing.
dar213.title: Damping Sphere

dar215.flavor:
"The perfection of the lotus reminds me of my hopes for this world . . . and my failures. I will not rest until I've atoned for them."
—Karn
dar215.title: Gilded Lotus

dar216.flavor: Archaeologists depend on automatons inspired by their previous discoveries at Koilos to guard the excavations.
dar216.title: Guardians of Koilos

dar217.flavor: Forged out of flowstone for the queen of Vesuva.
dar217.title: Helm of the Host

dar218.flavor: It wails of buried riches and the souls lost seeking them.
dar218.title: Howling Golem

dar219.flavor: Ice may thaw, but malice never does.
dar219.title: Icy Manipulator

dar220.flavor:
"You could say it was my pet project."
—Jhoira
dar220.title: Jhoira's Familiar

dar222.flavor:
"Urza's machines have a splendid habit of excavating themselves."
—Rona, disciple of Gix
dar222.title: Juggernaut

dar223.flavor: It has witnessed history's most significant events, one incarnation after another.
dar223.title: Mishra's Self-Replicator

dar224.flavor: A moment in time made tangible, it has the power to realize epic visions.
dar224.title: Mox Amber

dar225.flavor: The Weatherlight can no longer planeshift, but it can traverse Dominaria with ease.
dar225.title: Navigator's Compass

dar226.flavor:
"To the head of Archaeological Findings: The excavation schedule at dig site 93-beta must be revised. Part of the site has walked off."
—Tolarian field dispatch
dar226.title: Pardic Wanderer

dar227.flavor:
"Light passing through a powerstone is refracted by eternity and colored by planar energy. I wonder how the world appeared through Urza's eyes?"
—Teferi
dar227.title: Powerstone Shard

dar228.flavor: Benalish glazeplate is stained with salts from the Rift Era and enchanted to deflect blows.
dar228.title: Shield of the Realm

dar229.flavor: "Sometimes the only difference between a martyr and a hero is a sword." —Captain Sisay, Memoirs
dar229.title: Short Sword

dar230.flavor: Like a cross between a spider and a spyglass, but friendlier.
dar230.title: Skittering Surveyor

dar232.flavor: The trainers were a gift of gratitude from the wizards of Tolaria West to the knights of New Benalia for their aid during the Talas Incursion.
dar232.title: Sparring Construct

dar233.flavor: The portal opens not to the past, but from it. Those who step through discover an unimaginable future.
dar233.title: Thran Temporal Gateway

dar235.flavor:
"Truly understanding even one volume can be a life's work."
—Naru Meha, master wizard
dar235.title: Urza's Tome

dar236.flavor: A missing piece in search of a puzzle.
dar236.title: Voltaic Servant

dar238.flavor: The seat of Belzenlok's power, the Stronghold serves as the gathering place for the Cabal as their dark influence spreads from Urborg.
dar238.title: Cabal Stronghold

dar239.flavor: The sunlight falls pristine on the temple at Epityr, softened by the remembered shadows of angelic saviors' wings.
dar239.title: Clifftop Retreat

dar240.flavor:
"Our ancestors brought down a Phyrexian portal ship, then built our town on its hull. We're pretty proud of that."
—Alene of Riverspan
dar240.title: Hinterland Harbor

dar241.flavor: Serra's blessing lies strongest upon Sursi, where her holy chapels are untouched even as the Cabal encroaches.
dar241.title: Isolated Chapel

dar247.flavor:
"We have inherited the mysteries of the Thran, but few of the answers."
—Jhoira
dar247.title: Sulfur Falls

dar248.flavor:
"They never found the body of young Josu, or that of his murderous sister."
—"The Fall of the House of Vess"
dar248.title: Woodland Cemetery

dar249.flavor:
"The wind whispers, ‘come home,' but I cannot."
—Teferi
dar249.title: Zhalfirin Void

dar271.flavor: The Cabal soldier blinked and found day had become night, he had a face full of thistle seeds, and the old man was nowhere to be seen.
dar271.title: Temporal Machinations

dar272.flavor: "My father will be happy to see you."
dar272.title: Niambi, Faithful Healer

dar273.flavor:
"Long ago, I enchanted an army of statues to guard Zhalfir. My homeland is gone, but its protectors remain."
—Teferi
dar273.title: Teferi's Sentinel

dar274.flavor:
"Everywhere you look, this world is healing from its wounds. Aren't you ready to do the same?"
—Jhoira, to Teferi
dar274.title: Meandering River

dar277.flavor:
"Don't worry, they don't bite. They much prefer setting people on fire."
—Jaya Ballard, to Chandra
dar277.title: Karplusan Hound

dar278.flavor: "From the volcanoes of Shiv to the Balduvian steppes, I have sought a worthy teacher. At last, I have found one."
dar278.title: Pyromantic Pilgrim

dar279.flavor: Glaciers, torrential floods, and temporal disturbances came and went. The mountains yet stood, unchanged.
dar279.title: Timber Gorge

m191.flavor: Inner strength is never seen until it makes all the difference.
m191.title: Aegis of the Heavens

m192.flavor: Most smiths shape metal, but some prefer more delicate materials.
m192.title: Aethershield Artificer

m195.flavor:
"When one of us prospers, the pride prospers."
—Jazal Goldmane
m195.title: Ajani's Pridemate

m196.flavor: "You cannot defend others if your own well-being is neglected."
m196.title: Ajani's Welcome

m197.flavor: She sings for all those who have been silenced.
m197.title: Angel of the Dawn

m199.flavor: In their final moments, the demons gazed upon grace in its purest form.
m199.title: Cleansing Nova

m1910.flavor: "May the light shine through me to guide the lost."
m1910.title: Daybreak Chaplain

m1911.flavor: "These storied halls are under my protection."
m1911.title: Dwarven Priest

m1912.flavor: "Our duty does not stop at our borders."
m1912.title: Gallant Cavalry

m1913.flavor: The clerics prayed for salvation. The soldiers prayed for victory. Both prayers were answered.
m1913.title: Herald of Faith

m1915.flavor:
"Impossible! How could they overwhelm us? We had barricades, war elephants, . . . and they were barely a tenth of our number!"
—General Avitora
m1915.title: Inspired Charge

m1916.flavor: "Let go of all that harms you. Cast your burdens into the darkness, and build for the faithful a house of light." —Song of All, canto 1008
m1916.title: Invoke the Divine

m1917.flavor: Threefold were his crimes, doubled were his pleas, singular was his fate.
m1917.title: Isolate

m1919.flavor: "As long as my faith persists, so shall I."
m1919.title: Knight's Pledge

m1921.flavor: "Those who do evil and those who do nothing are equally worthy of contempt."
