m1921.title: Lena, Selfless Champion

m1922.flavor: The best fighters are skilled in both harming and healing.
m1922.title: Leonin Vanguard

m1923.flavor: When one leonin hunts, many more are surely nearby.
m1923.title: Leonin Warleader

m1924.flavor: Loxodons are firm in stature and spirit. No matter the odds, they are always first into battle.
m1924.title: Loxodon Line Breaker

m1925.flavor: "Your part in this fight is done, vampire. Get used to your thirst."
m1925.title: Luminous Bonds

m1926.flavor: For a moment they stood tall, all fear forgotten.
m1926.title: Make a Stand

m1927.flavor: "In these halls there is no pass or fail. Your true test comes with the first full moon."
m1927.title: Mentor of the Meek

m1928.flavor: "I feel the presence of the God-Pharaoh in the Second Sun, and I rise upon its rays."
m1928.title: Mighty Leap

m1930.flavor: Even the greatest hero begins with nothing.
m1930.title: Novice Knight

m1931.flavor: The leonin of Oreskos are quick to take offense—not because they are thin-skinned, but because they are always ready for a fight.
m1931.title: Oreskos Swiftclaw

m1932.flavor: A pegasus chooses its rider, bearing the worthy into the clouds and tossing all others to the ground.
m1932.title: Pegasus Courser

m1933.flavor: A lifetime of keeping up appearances is not enough to earn an eternity of rest.
m1933.title: Remorseful Cleric

m1935.flavor:
"A potion is no substitute for a skilled surgeon, but it will hold your bits in."
—Torricks, battlefield medic
m1935.title: Revitalize

m1936.flavor: Native to wide prairies and scrublands, falcons occasionally roost in dragon skeletons.
m1936.title: Rustwing Falcon

m1937.flavor: When it passes, order defeats chaos.
m1937.title: Shield Mare

m1938.flavor: White as starlight on snow, it appears only on the eve of the winter solstice.
m1938.title: Star-Crowned Stag

m1940.flavor: "Your death will be a balm, your passing a welcome revision, and all will sigh with peace to know of your demise."
m1940.title: Take Vengeance

m1941.flavor:
"Margaret has traveled with me to the end of the world and back."
—Hewen Frit, merchant
m1941.title: Trusty Packbeast

m1942.flavor: "Defeat is no reason for retreat. It is a sign we must redouble our efforts to win this fight."
m1942.title: Valiant Knight

m1943.flavor: If you can't find a doorway, make one.
m1943.title: Aether Tunnel

m1944.flavor: Divining the future is easy when you hold the power to sway it.
m1944.title: Anticipate

m1945.flavor: "My skill sharpens with each beat of my wings."
m1945.title: Aven Wind Mage

m1946.flavor: "They say perfection is unattainable, but they said that about flight too."
m1946.title: Aviation Pioneer

m1947.flavor:
"I can think of worse ways to go. On second thought, maybe not."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist
m1947.title: Bone to Ash

m1948.flavor: "I decide what stands in my way."
m1948.title: Cancel

m1950.flavor: It's pointless to hold on when you have nothing to hold on with.
m1950.title: Disperse

m1951.flavor: "The stars mark your destiny. May you accept the fate thus divulged."
m1951.title: Divination

m1953.flavor: The collection didn't have room to expand, so the wizard improvised a solution.
m1953.title: Dwindle

m1954.flavor: Dependence on luck is anathema to Kefnet's rigorous studies. Those who hope to escape his maze by chance never succeed.
m1954.title: Essence Scatter

m1955.flavor: Successful battles start with knowing who's worth fighting.
m1955.title: Exclusion Mage

m1956.flavor:
"Reel it in. No, wait! Throw it back!"
—Gertrude, deep-sea angler
m1956.title: Frilled Sea Serpent

m1957.flavor: Young artificers on Kaladesh let their imaginations run wild.
m1957.title: Gearsmith Prodigy

m1961.flavor: The life of a shapeshifter is one of constant change.
m1961.title: Mirror Image

m1962.flavor: Hospitality is of little concern to those who do not wish to be disturbed.
m1962.title: Mistcaller

m1963.flavor: The delight of discovery drives the pursuit of knowledge.
m1963.title: Mystic Archaeologist

m1964.flavor: Her prophecies amaze her even as she speaks them.
m1964.title: Omenspeaker

m1965.flavor:
"The things I once imagined would be my greatest achievements were only the first steps toward a future I can only begin to fathom."
—Jace Beleren
m1965.title: Omniscience

m1966.flavor:
"When I grafted the Planar Bridge into myself I felt my Planeswalker spark flare beyond my body. The Multiverse was my plaything. It felt . . . incredible."
—Tezzeret
m1966.title: One with the Machine

m1967.flavor: Nicol Bolas would not rest until he was restored to his former glory.
m1967.title: Patient Rebuilding

m1968.flavor:
"To break another's mind is to deliver a fate worse than death. It is a terrifying power."
—Jace Beleren
m1968.title: Psychic Corrosion

m1969.flavor: "Industry without artistry is just a fancy way to fill the junkyard."
m1969.title: Sai, Master Thopterist

m1970.flavor: The greatest treasure of the deep is an echo from above.
m1970.title: Salvager of Secrets

m1971.flavor: "The path of the stars is as reliable as the instruments that measure them."
m1971.title: Scholar of Stars

m1972.flavor: Dwell longest on the thoughts that shine brightest.
m1972.title: Sift

m1974.flavor:
"I give them dreams so wondrous that they hesitate to return to the world of the conscious."
—Garild, merfolk mage
m1974.title: Sleep

m1975.flavor: Foul-tempered, poorly trained, and mule-stubborn, the drake is the perfect test of the master's will.
m1975.title: Snapping Drake

m1976.flavor: A king's knowledge does not vanish when the heart stops beating.
m1976.title: Supreme Phantom

m1977.flavor: When it passes, waves touch the sky.
m1977.title: Surge Mare

m1978.flavor: Say hello to your new friend.
m1978.title: Switcheroo

m1980.flavor: The Tolarian Academies embrace a tradition of study and research while discouraging the kinds of experiments that ruined the original island of Tolaria.
m1980.title: Tolarian Scholar

m1982.flavor: The cold slowed their movements until only their panicked eyeballs swiveled beneath the ice.
m1982.title: Uncomfortable Chill

m1983.flavor: The seafloor is flecked with the bones of fools who dared to sail into the mist.
m1983.title: Wall of Mist

m1984.flavor: "Your mind is too filled with foolish concerns to hear the subtle whispers that the breeze brings."
m1984.title: Windreader Sphinx

m1986.flavor: Predicting the future is a messy business.
m1986.title: Blood Divination

m1987.flavor:
"They are gentle herbivores, despite their size. Approach cautiously, and hum a tune to let them know you mean no harm."
—Vivien Reid
m1987.title: Bogstomper

m1988.flavor: Its roar is the clatter of a thousand bones.
m1988.title: Bone Dragon

m1989.flavor: Sins that would be too gruesome in the light of day are made more pleasing in the dark of night.
m1989.title: Child of Night

m1990.flavor: For the necromancer barons, killing and recruitment are one and the same.
m1990.title: Death Baron

m1991.flavor: A pit yawned open, a column of oily smoke arose, and a towering form hissed, "I accept this offering."
m1991.title: Demon of Catastrophes

m1992.flavor:
"At least this one still has arms and legs. Well, most of its legs."
—Enslow, ghoulcaller of Nephalia
m1992.title: Diregraf Ghoul

m1993.flavor: There is only one fate left to those banished from the God-Pharaoh's city.
m1993.title: Doomed Dissenter

m1995.flavor: "Fleshy, with just a hint of leather. A fine vintage."
m1995.title: Epicure of Blood

m1997.flavor: The Great Mending that healed the Multiverse also unraveled the threads of Nicol Bolas's power.
m1997.title: Fraying Omnipotence

m1998.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.
m1998.title: Gravedigger

m1999.flavor:
"Rise and shine, my dears. We have work to do."
—Isareth the Awakener
m1999.title: Graveyard Marshal

m19100.flavor: "If you want them dead, buy some poison. If you want them to have the worst day of their life before dying, then let's talk price."
m19100.title: Hired Blade

m19101.flavor: Not once in the history of Grixis has anyone died of old age.
m19101.title: Infectious Horror

m19102.flavor: "When these intruders are gone, Zendikar will be my throne, my palace, my playground."
m19102.title: Infernal Reckoning

m19103.flavor: One who is marked by a demon in life is sure to be remembered as one in death.
m19103.title: Infernal Scarring

m19105.flavor: A lich must consume mortal souls to feed its eternal life.
m19105.title: Lich's Caress

m19108.flavor: Liliana is never one to follow someone else's lead.
m19108.title: Macabre Waltz

m19109.flavor: Many an inventor has collapsed under the pressure to create a flawless design.
m19109.title: Mind Rot

m19110.flavor: "It's not work if you enjoy it."
m19110.title: Murder

m19111.flavor: That feeling of something on your chest is usually sleep paralysis. Occasionally, it's something else.
m19111.title: Nightmare's Thirst

m19112.flavor: It was a night like any other. It would soon become a night no one would ever forget.
m19112.title: Open the Graves

m19114.flavor: When it passes, those who sleep dream of sickness and death.
m19114.title: Plague Mare

m19115.flavor: A harpy's hoard is a filthy, bloodstained pile of trinkets and corpses.
m19115.title: Ravenous Harpy

m19116.flavor:
"They may show up with the wrong thigh bone or mandible, but they always show up."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord
m19116.title: Reassembling Skeleton

m19117.flavor:
"Death is no excuse for disobedience."
—Liliana Vess
m19117.title: Rise from the Grave

m19118.flavor:
"When it comes to killing with precision, a soul is but a hindrance."
—Isareth the Awakener
m19118.title: Skeleton Archer

m19119.flavor: From the perpetual shadowsmoke that hung above the ship, a silent form emerged, lips curled with malice and anticipation.
m19119.title: Skymarch Bloodletter

m19120.flavor:
"You have given all to your kingdom, dear knight. Serenity shall be your prize."
—Queen Lian
m19120.title: Sovereign's Bite

m19122.flavor: Imagine a thousand tiny mushrooms cropping up within your lungs.
m19122.title: Strangling Spores

m19123.flavor: "Thread the torsos together with angel hair to ensure they will cooperate in battle." —The Stitcher's Tome
m19123.title: Two-Headed Zombie

m19124.flavor: One day, they may be paragons of deadly elegance. For the moment, they possess nothing but thirst.
m19124.title: Vampire Neonate

m19126.flavor:
"Feeding a normal army is a problem of logistics. With zombies, it is an asset. Feeding is why they fight. Feeding is why they are feared."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia
m19126.title: Walking Corpse

m19127.flavor: She learned a tragic lesson that day: even the purest can be corrupted when the heart's emotions are twisted.
m19127.title: Act of Treason

m19129.flavor:
"As I desire, so it shall be."
—Nicol Bolas
m19129.title: Apex of Power

m19130.flavor: For Sarkhan Vol, the dragon is the purest expression of life's savage splendor.
m19130.title: Banefire

m19131.flavor: He has the biggest bashing stick, so it's a safe bet he's the leader.
m19131.title: Boggart Brute

m19132.flavor: As the hyperstormic generator crept past redline, a being emerged from the arc.
m19132.title: Catalyst Elemental

m19134.flavor: Eyes are unnecessary for seeing the future.
m19134.title: Dark-Dweller Oracle

m19135.flavor: A knight's devotion to their steed goes only so far.
m19135.title: Demanding Dragon

m19137.flavor: First the insult, then the encore.
m19137.title: Doublecast

m19138.flavor: Dragon birth lairs are littered with treasure to entice the young from their eggs.
m19138.title: Dragon Egg

m19139.flavor: "Some hid from the storm. I embraced it and learned its name."
m19139.title: Electrify

m19141.flavor: It treads on feet of coals and strikes with the force of a volcano.
m19141.title: Fire Elemental

m19144.flavor: "Folks 'round here are too in love with their contraptions. Does them some good if we smash one every so often."
m19144.title: Goblin Trashmaster

m19145.flavor: "I found a new toy. Wanna play?"
m19145.title: Guttersnipe

m19146.flavor: For devils, burning things is the highest form of comedy, diversion, and artistic expression.
m19146.title: Havoc Devils

m19147.flavor: The bellow of a minotaur always translates to "charge."
m19147.title: Hostile Minotaur

m19151.flavor: When it passes, storm clouds bolt across the land.
m19151.title: Lightning Mare

m19152.flavor: To wield lightning is to tame chaos.
m19152.title: Lightning Strike

m19153.flavor: The ogres you know are nothing like the Onakke. Possessing both intellect and industry, they had brute strength without being brutish.
m19153.title: Onakke Ogre

m19156.flavor: The tools of invention became the weapons of revolution.
m19156.title: Shock

m19157.flavor: No rampart can withstand the fury of a giant.
m19157.title: Siegebreaker Giant

m19158.flavor: The creation of new weapons demands the destruction of others.
m19158.title: Smelt

m19159.flavor: Fools believe that Kolaghan's brood follows lightning storms. The wise know that it is the other way around.
m19159.title: Sparktongue Dragon

m19161.flavor: To survive imminent doom, it sometimes takes a foolhardy soul who acts first and fears later.
m19161.title: Sure Strike

m19162.flavor:
"You will kneel before me, even if I have to split the earth under your feet!"
—Ash Kronor, Keldon warlord
m19162.title: Tectonic Rift

m19164.flavor:
"Unwelcome thoughts crowd my mind. Are they my own madness, or the whispers of another?"
—Sarkhan Vol
m19164.title: Tormenting Voice

m19165.flavor: The sound of the trumpets lights a fire in the hearts of the bold and snuffs the courage of the cowardly.
m19165.title: Trumpet Blast

m19166.flavor: "I trained with the Ghitu, and I respect the fire as they do."
m19166.title: Viashino Pyromancer

m19167.flavor: Sometimes an eruption in Shiv produces something more dangerous than a mere river of molten rock.
m19167.title: Volcanic Dragon

m19170.flavor:
"Nicol Bolas destroyed my world. I owe it to Skalla to celebrate all life, no matter how dangerous."
—Vivien Reid
m19170.title: Bristling Boar

m19171.flavor:
"The centaurs are truly free. Never will they be tamed by temptation or controlled by fear. They live in total harmony, a feat not yet achieved by our kind."
—Ramal, sage of Westgate
m19171.title: Centaur Courser

m19172.flavor: If you feel the ground quake, run. If you hear its bellow, flee. If you see its teeth, it's too late.
m19172.title: Colossal Dreadmaw

m19173.flavor:
"Might doesn't just build empires. It protects them."
—Inti, Sun Empire knight
m19173.title: Colossal Majesty

m19174.flavor: Its ventricles weep venom, and it consumes only poison.
m19174.title: Daggerback Basilisk

m19175.flavor:
"If you think yourself a chief, then prove your might."
—Gar-Tun, Mistvalley silverback
m19175.title: Declare Dominance

m19176.flavor: No welcome for those who trespass. Only fang and horn and claw.
m19176.title: Druid of Horns

m19177.flavor: "The wild tangle of the Cowl provides sanctuary to life that watched the first buildings rise."
m19177.title: Druid of the Cowl

m19178.flavor: "The land already knows its destiny. I simply ask it to share the tale with me."
m19178.title: Dryad Greenseeker

m19179.flavor: No single root feeds the forest.
m19179.title: Elvish Clancaller

m19181.flavor: They grow closer with every passing season.
m19181.title: Ghastbark Twins

m19182.flavor: Fairgoers were delighted to find that even outside the fairgrounds, Ghirapur was a city of wonders.
m19182.title: Ghirapur Guide

m19183.flavor:
"After everything I've survived, it's hard to be frightened by anything anymore."
—Vivien Reid
m19183.title: Giant Spider

m19185.flavor:
"Each tooth is the length of a horse, and new ones grow in every sixteen days. Let's get a closer look!"
—Vivien Reid
m19185.title: Gigantosaurus

m19186.flavor: You don't want to know how she got that name.
m19186.title: Goreclaw, Terror of Qal Sisma

m19187.flavor: Within a mile of the woodland, you will feel her eyes upon you. Within its borders, you will feel her blade.
m19187.title: Greenwood Sentinel

m19188.flavor:
"Bring down a stag and fix its horns upon Arel's head. She hears the wisdom of our ancestors."
—Chianul, Who Whispers Twice
m19188.title: Highland Game

m19190.flavor:
"And if you threaten me again, your shiny steel trousers will be sprouting daggerthorn vines."
—Iveta, rooftop runner
m19190.title: Naturalize

m19191.flavor:
"When the beast cloaks itself in the mighty oak, what good is a bow? When the oak wraps itself around the snarling beast, what good is a hatchet?"
—Dionus, elvish archdruid
m19191.title: Oakenform

m19192.flavor: It eats what it wants to eat—which is anything that moves.
m19192.title: Pelakka Wurm

m19193.flavor:
"Let nothing own the skies but the wind."
—Dejara, Giltwood druid
m19193.title: Plummet

m19194.flavor:
"Look how cute it is now!"
—Vivien Reid
m19194.title: Prodigious Growth

m19195.flavor: "You should have seen the look on both their faces." —Morkamp, Lambholt innkeeper
m19195.title: Rabid Bite

m19196.flavor: "What was once formed by masons, shaped by smiths, or given life by mages, I will return to the embrace of the earth."
m19196.title: Reclamation Sage

m19197.flavor: "The bones of the past will tell their tales—if you know how to speak their language."
m19197.title: Recollect

m19198.flavor: "The further into the future I look, the less certain my vision. Even now, the middle distance is obscured by fire."
m19198.title: Rhox Oracle

m19199.flavor: The only casualties were a snapped spear, a lost helmet, and some bruised egos.
m19199.title: Root Snare

m19200.flavor: The Sun Empire's most sacred sites are protected by more than prayers.
m19200.title: Runic Armasaur

m19201.flavor: "Whether we like it or not, our arrival has altered the landscape." —Malcolm, navigator of the Belligerent
m19201.title: Scapeshift

m19204.flavor:
"Halana grew brambles to create a barricade around our camp, hoping that it would keep the wolves out. That was a mistake for which we almost paid dearly."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig
m19204.title: Thornhide Wolves

m19205.flavor: The massive dominate through might. The tiny survive with guile. Beware the tiny who become massive.
m19205.title: Titanic Growth

m19206.flavor: Villagers employ watchdogs as guardians and companions. Druids prefer something a little bigger.
m19206.title: Vigilant Baloth

m19207.flavor: When it passes, the dead are displaced by flourishing life.
m19207.title: Vine Mare

m19210.flavor: Like all jungle plants, the vines must fight and claw for sunlight. Once their place is secured, they grow strong, sharp, and impenetrable.
m19210.title: Wall of Vines

m19211.flavor: The best of their trade know every bolt of their rigs, stem to stern.
m19211.title: Aerial Engineer

m19215.flavor: "If I am to die, I will die in the embrace of immeasurable flame."
m19215.title: Draconic Disciple

m19216.flavor: Many initiates believe it possesses secrets beyond imagining. Many have become meals trying to learn them.
m19216.title: Enigma Drake

m19217.flavor: Cries of anguish quickly spurred cries of action.
m19217.title: Heroic Reinforcements

m19219.flavor: Sister of Nicol Bolas. Survivor of the Elder Dragon War. The most vicious of her kin.
m19219.title: Palladia-Mors, the Ruiner

m19221.flavor: "I turn around and see nothing, yet I know it is behind me. Its fingers rummage in my mind, crafting new ideas."
m19221.title: Psychic Symbiont

m19222.flavor: Those of esteemed birth earn a most esteemed death.
m19222.title: Regal Bloodlord

m19223.flavor: "The threads of magic that protect this place were woven by my will."
m19223.title: Satyr Enchanter

m19226.flavor: Whether it is magical, lucky, or merely old, it is cherished, and that gives it power.
m19226.title: Amulet of Safekeeping

m19227.flavor: Knowledge itself is neither good nor evil. Just as the wrong book in the wrong hands could doom all existence, the same book in the right hands could save it.
m19227.title: Arcane Encyclopedia

m19229.flavor: Amidst the darkest ashes grow the strongest seeds.
m19229.title: Crucible of Worlds

m19230.flavor: The grave robbers were startled, for the door to the mausoleum was already open.
m19230.title: Desecrated Tomb

m19233.flavor:
"Souls are volatile things. When compressed and loaded into a handheld device, their destructive potential is quite impressive."
—Dierk, geistmage
m19233.title: Explosive Apparatus

m19234.flavor: As it walks across the fallow field, its awkward, loping gait matches the rattling in its head to create a haunting rhythm that chills the bones.
m19234.title: Field Creeper

m19235.flavor: Entrepreneurs have attempted to sell the water, but to no avail. Whatever magic it contains disappears upon bottling.
m19235.title: Fountain of Renewal

m19236.flavor:
"Do not mistake a quiet rampart for one that is unguarded. Some things stir only when they need to."
—Bonovar, siege commander
m19236.title: Gargoyle Sentinel

m19237.flavor: Made in its creator's image, though slightly more clangy.
m19237.title: Gearsmith Guardian

m19239.flavor: Planeswalkers seek out great monuments throughout the Multiverse, knowing that their builders were unwittingly drawn by the convergence of mana in the area.
m19239.title: Manalith

m19240.flavor: A sharp axe solves most problems.
m19240.title: Marauder's Axe

m19241.flavor: The impact sent the soldiers scattering—then something came out of the crater.
m19241.title: Meteor Golem

m19242.flavor: Minds, like mountains, are never so grand and mighty that they can't be reduced to dust.
m19242.title: Millstone

m19243.flavor: Thievery requires subtlety, from the beginning of the heist to the end.
m19243.title: Rogue's Gloves

m19245.flavor: The municipal senate makes extensive use of the thopters, mostly to gather dirt on rival senators.
m19245.title: Skyscanner

m19246.flavor: All the books were dusty with disuse, save the one titled Camouflage and Its Practical Applications.
m19246.title: Suspicious Bookcase

m19248.flavor:
"I do as I choose with what is mine. And it is all mine."
—Nicol Bolas
m19248.title: Cinder Barrens

m19249.flavor: Its light exposes enemies and lays secrets bare.
m19249.title: Detection Tower

m19250.flavor:
"Prayers will curdle on the tongue and be heard by rotting ears."
—Minaldra, the Vizag Atum
m19250.title: Forsaken Sanctuary

m19251.flavor: The stench of rotting meat lures flies, goblins, and young raptors.
m19251.title: Foul Orchard

m19252.flavor:
"A place like this makes me wonder if there's more to life than blood and treasure . . . Nah."
—Boyl Bucksalt, Storm Fleet swab
m19252.title: Highland Lake

m19253.flavor: The river split into many channels as it flowed to the Halimar Sea. Few travelers could follow the same one twice.
m19253.title: Meandering River

m19254.flavor: The most holy treasures are kept far from unclean soil.
m19254.title: Reliquary Tower

m19256.flavor: The bedrock has many gifts to give.
m19256.title: Stone Quarry

m19257.flavor:
"Long after the land has given up the last of its secrets, there will still be mysteries in the depths of the sea."
—Kiora
m19257.title: Submerged Boneyard

m19258.flavor: Tazeem's embrace is harsh, but for those that call it home, nothing else will do.
m19258.title: Timber Gorge

m19259.flavor: Beyond the chaos of Ghirapur lies a vibrant world where aether flows through nature.
m19259.title: Tranquil Expanse

m19260.flavor: Waterways carve their routes through the land to reflect the paths the aether streams cut through the clouds.
m19260.title: Woodland Stream

m19283.flavor:
"The healers of Bant are second to none. I owe them a great deal for their tutelage."
—Ajani Goldmane
m19283.title: Court Cleric

m19284.flavor: She watches over the city just as Serra watches over all.
m19284.title: Serra's Guardian

m19285.flavor: A pair of domesticated griffins escaped from captivity a century ago. Now the skies are filled with the songs of their descendants.
m19285.title: Silverbeak Griffin

m19287.flavor: "Safe passage requires only a simple answer to a simple question, traveler."
m19287.title: Riddlemaster Sphinx

m19288.flavor: Its elaborate designs reveal secrets of aether's flow.
m19288.title: Pendulum of Patterns

m19292.flavor:
"I'm not picky about what comes up, but the less decay, the better."
—Liliana Vess
m19292.title: Arisen Gorgon

m19293.flavor: Once every seven years it flies on spectral wings over the moors of ancient battlefields.
m19293.title: Gravewaker

m19295.flavor: The dead who wander beyond the safety of the city of Naktamun crave only to spread their curse.
m19295.title: Tattered Mummy

m19297.flavor: "Only those who give the dragons the respect they deserve may bear our title."
m19297.title: Kargan Dragonrider

m19298.flavor: "I am most myself when I am least human."
m19298.title: Sarkhan's Dragonfire

m19300.flavor: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.
m19300.title: Shivan Dragon

m19302.flavor:
"Approach from behind. That way, if it does charge, at least you aren't in front of it."
—Vivien Reid
m19302.title: Aggressive Mammoth

m19303.flavor:
"This imprint was the familiar of a friend."
—Vivien Reid
m19303.title: Skalla Wolf

m19304.flavor: "Would you rather feel the edge of my blade or the sharpness of my fangs?"
m19304.title: Ursine Champion

m19305.flavor: Each of Vivien's arrows is an invocation of a species.
m19305.title: Vivien's Jaguar

m19306.flavor: Sarkhan wandered into a tomb and back in time.
m19306.title: Nexus of Fate

m19307.flavor: Just as the sun rises at dawn and the days lengthen in summer, the Sun Empire has awakened after long years of quiet.
m19307.title: Sun Sentinel

m19308.flavor: As the ship approached, the jade totem rose high overhead. Power rippled. Eyes of stone glowed and crackled. Out hissed a breath of the world, and a windstorm came alive.
m19308.title: Air Elemental

m19309.flavor: The trick to talking sense into Keldons is getting them to hold still.
m19309.title: Befuddle

m19310.flavor: With matchless stealth, the River Heralds fought a running battle against enemy forces.
m19310.title: Mist-Cloaked Herald

m19312.flavor: "I can hear the plunder calling. It asks for me by name."
m19312.title: Grasping Scoundrel

m19313.flavor: As the Cabal legions pushed into Shiv, they learned not to stand so close together.
m19313.title: Radiating Lightning

m19314.flavor: As patient and generous as life, as harsh and merciless as nature.
m19314.title: Llanowar Elves

dar280.flavor: The peaks of Hurloon never fall silent.
dar280.title: Firesong and Sunspeaker

g18GP1.flavor: "No single arrow can pierce an entire flock."
g18GP1.title: Angelic Guardian

g18GP2.flavor: It is ancient, immense, and irresistible.
g18GP2.title: Angler Turtle

g18GP3.flavor: "Those who stood in my path now lay behind me."
g18GP3.title: Vengeant Vampire

g18GP4.flavor: Their fires burn quietly, allowing the phoenixes to glide silently through the canyon.
g18GP4.title: Immortal Phoenix

g18GP5.flavor: Not even the tallest tree stands a chance against the underside of a dinosaur's foot.
g18GP5.title: Rampaging Brontodon

grn1.flavor: "Watch carefully. The gap between death and victory is thinner than your blade."
grn1.title: Blade Instructor

grn2.flavor: "Lately I've seen the biggest bounties of my career—and for the biggest names."
grn2.title: Bounty Agent

grn3.flavor: Selesnya guildmages do not sleep so the rest of the Conclave can.
grn3.title: Candlelight Vigil

grn4.flavor:
"Oh, you fellas are going to love the lockup. Excellent gruel. Very low ceilings."
—Libuse, Boros sergeant
grn4.title: Citywide Bust

grn5.flavor:
"Reports of Gruul rioters in four districts. Start with the big ones and work your way up."
—Libuse, Boros sergeant
grn5.title: Collar the Culprit

grn7.flavor: The Izzet mage knew she would neither get her thermoinverter back nor have the satisfaction of exploding it herself.
grn7.title: Crush Contraband

grn8.flavor:
"To wage war, secure peace within yourself."
—Emmara
grn8.title: Dawn of Hope

grn9.flavor: There's no greater honor than joining your chosen guild, and no greater shame than failing it.
grn9.title: Demotion

grn10.flavor: The angels appreciated the offer but politely declined to eat any birdseed.
grn10.title: Divine Visitation

grn11.flavor: "Yes, there's competition between our equenauts and the Boros skyjeks. At least they think it's a competition."
grn11.title: Flight of Equenauts

grn12.flavor:
"You won't need the sword drills, your shields, or my blessing. You'll fight for Sunhome with the truth in your heart."
—Aurelia
grn12.title: Gird for Battle

grn13.flavor: Ravnica's convoluted power structure often boils down to who can muster the most swords on a given block.
grn13.title: Haazda Marshal

grn14.flavor: The wounded see the glow of its vials long before they see its wings diving out of the clouds.
grn14.title: Healer's Hawk

grn15.flavor: He ferried weapons, spells, exotic animals—but his most dangerous cargo was the truth.
grn15.title: Hunted Witness

grn16.flavor: There are two lives: the life you live before you see a unicorn, and the life you live after.
grn16.title: Inspiring Unicorn

grn17.flavor: Good at carrying things. Really good at knocking them down.
grn17.title: Intrusive Packbeast

grn18.flavor: "I've raised her since she was a pup, and she's raised me since I was a recruit."
grn18.title: Ledev Guardian

grn21.flavor: "Article 5.8.2. Ensure proper restraint of any and all arms, legs, claws, jaws, tails, tentacles, and tendrils as appropriate." —Azorius Arrester Procedure, Appendix B
grn21.title: Luminous Bonds

grn22.flavor: "Too many have disappeared in these dark days. I am the light that will lead them home."
grn22.title: Parhelion Patrol

grn23.flavor:
"The Golgari believe they should be given what they deserve. On this we agree."
—Tajic
grn23.title: Righteous Blow

grn24.flavor: Rocs' innate fearlessness makes them ideal mounts for emergency response.
grn24.title: Roc Charger

grn25.flavor: "Sometimes an angel passes by and gives me a little nod, like, ‘You're a daring one!' That always makes my day."
grn25.title: Skyline Scout

grn26.flavor: "Before I let you wield one of these, let's see you dodge one!"
grn26.title: Sunhome Stalwart

grn27.flavor:
"The trouble with youths these days is that, in outright defiance of their elders, they refuse to be bought."
—Karlov of the Ghost Council
grn27.title: Sworn Companions

grn28.flavor: In the quiet before a battle, Boros soldiers whisper prayers that steady their nerves and focus their minds.
grn28.title: Take Heart

grn29.flavor: "The Tenth has always been my home. This city is constantly embroiled in one crisis or another, but I'm determined to protect my piece."
grn29.title: Tenth District Guard

grn32.flavor: "My specialty is theoretical universal limits and ways to circumvent them."
grn32.title: Chemister's Insight

grn33.flavor: All those who trade in questions must answer to the Dimir.
grn33.title: Citywatch Sphinx

grn35.flavor: First, dispose of the evidence. Then dispose of your knowledge of its disposal.
grn35.title: Devious Cover-Up

grn36.flavor: The letters arrive, all sealed and read.
grn36.title: Dimir Informant

grn37.flavor: "Laws apply only to those who lack the vision to see past them."
grn37.title: Disdainful Stroke

grn39.flavor: Beneath Ravnica's streets runs a layer of tunnels, then caverns and waterways, then terrors and nightmares.
grn39.title: Drowned Secrets

grn40.flavor:
"Who are the agents of the Dimir? No one and everyone."
—Lazav
grn40.title: Enhanced Surveillance

grn41.flavor: In a climate of suspicion, Isperia gathered the guilds to propose a radical idea: cooperation.
grn41.title: Guild Summit

grn42.flavor:
"Most compete for insects at street level. Some dwell near Izzet laboratories and ride the thermal updrafts."
—Yolov, Simic bioengineer
grn42.title: Leapfrog

grn45.flavor: Rumors float through the city like crows, alighting on citizens seemingly at random.
grn45.title: Murmuring Mystic

grn46.flavor: A composer wrote a symphony based on the drakes screeching outside her window. Reviews were mixed—except among the drakes.
grn46.title: Muse Drake

grn47.flavor:
"What bait do you cast to catch a dream?"
—Ravnican riddle
grn47.title: Narcomoeba

grn48.flavor:
"We're on the fortieth floor, with one window, no balcony. No one could possibly get in."
—Minosz, Orzhov chief of security
grn48.title: Nightveil Sprite

grn49.flavor: She memorized every arcane text in the Ismeri Library by the time she was sixteen. Now she quizzes sphinxes in her spare time.
grn49.title: Omnispell Adept

grn50.flavor: "My doors are called trespassing, my signatures, forgeries. They don't respect my talents, and I don't respect their labels."
grn50.title: Passwall Adept

grn52.flavor: Genius is finding the edge of what's possible, then jumping over it.
grn52.title: Radical Idea

grn53.flavor:
"How thoughtful of the Legion to train its soldiers to fit our spell's specifications."
—Nefara, Dimir agent
grn53.title: Selective Snare

grn54.flavor:
"We have intel that some guilds have fallen under an invader's influence. Until we're sure, no venture succeeds."
—Lazav
grn54.title: Sinister Sabotage

grn56.flavor: The first thing the mist chills is the mind. Victims never cry out or even murmur in surprise.
grn56.title: Unexplained Disappearance

grn57.flavor: "There's no need to sound the alarm. You are minding your post admirably. I am authorized. All is well."
grn57.title: Vedalken Mesmerist

grn58.flavor: Fog haunts the streets, rendering the familiar as otherworldly, changing neighbors into shadows, and muffling cries for help.
grn58.title: Wall of Mist

grn60.flavor:
"What wishes do they grant? Mostly pinching-related ones."
—Omik, superintendent of waterworks
grn60.title: Wishcoin Crab

grn61.flavor: The Dimir rarely make statements, but when they do, the message is clear.
grn61.title: Barrier of Bones

grn62.flavor:
"Bats are welcome to eat thousands of my pets. I have multitudes more that will ultimately eat the bats."
—Izoni
grn62.title: Bartizan Bats

grn64.flavor:
"Even rats hoard their treasures. Are your precious things so different?"
—Izoni
grn64.title: Burglar Rat

grn65.flavor: No guilds—that is her rule. The House vampires unnerve her. The Combine would dissect her, the Legion burn her, the Conclave "cure" her. The shadows are all the family she needs.
grn65.title: Child of Night

grn67.flavor: All things considered, his first day on patrol could have gone better.
grn67.title: Dead Weight

grn69.flavor: The sound of every twisted secret tempts you to hear another.
grn69.title: Doom Whisperer

grn70.flavor: The party of Rakdos revelers cackled and capered as the thing approached. It hissed, and they jabbed their torches at it, giggling when it recoiled. Then, one by one, the torches went out—and the screaming began.
grn70.title: Douser of Lights

grn71.flavor:
"Variety is also the spice of death."
—Cevraya, Golgari shaman
grn71.title: Gruesome Menagerie

grn72.flavor: "They don't even feel the cut. I'm ordering a drink in a nearby tavern before anyone notices something's wrong."
grn72.title: Hired Poisoner

grn73.flavor: The hive has a long memory. It knows how every member ever died, and to whom it owes the grudge.
grn73.title: Kraul Swarm

grn74.flavor:
"I prefer the big and looming to the small and skittering."
—Cevraya, Golgari shaman
grn74.title: Lotleth Giant

grn76.flavor: Ravnica's safest strongholds are often neither.
grn76.title: Mephitic Vapors

grn77.flavor: No one welcomes his visit, yet all must grant him tribute.
grn77.title: Midnight Reaper

grn79.flavor: The assassins of the Ochran distill toxins from the remains of their previous victims.
grn79.title: Necrotic Wound

grn80.flavor: Dimir assassins have the precision to slay a single memory.
grn80.title: Never Happened

grn82.flavor: "My power is generosity, in a way. I give my survivors an appreciation for their lives."
grn82.title: Plaguecrafter

grn84.flavor: Only the patrol's armor was found, so tainted with the acrid smell of sudden death that it could never be worn again.
grn84.title: Ritual of Soot

grn85.flavor: "I've seen Ravnica's fate. Believe me, I'm doing you a favor."
grn85.title: Severed Strands

grn86.flavor: The Golgari adorn themselves with the exoskeletons of iridescent insects. It's only fair the insects do likewise.
grn86.title: Spinal Centipede

grn87.flavor: In its territory, living is an affront.
grn87.title: Undercity Necrolisk

grn88.flavor:
"I sang songs of sorrow for my lost love. Imagine my horror when, one night, they were answered."
—Milana, Orzhov prelate
grn88.title: Veiled Shade

grn89.flavor:
"The alliances were already frayed. All we do is find the loose threads and pluck."
—Lazav
grn89.title: Vicious Rumors

grn90.flavor: "Sure, I hear things. I hear plenty. But how am I to talk with this parched throat?"
grn90.title: Whispering Snitch

grn92.flavor: "Don't stop till your horns come out their back."
grn92.title: Barging Sergeant

grn93.flavor: "Not my first edition of The Advokist and the Urchin!"
grn93.title: Book Devourer

grn94.flavor: In the wake of Niv-Mizzet's disappearance, Ral found himself leading the guild. He had dreamed of this day, but couldn't help feeling like a pawn in someone else's game.
grn94.title: Command the Storm

grn95.flavor: "This sort of innovation occurs when you set out to improve an electric tea kettle and misplace a decimal."
grn95.title: Cosmotronic Wave

grn97.flavor:
"It's both an ingress-denial mechanism and an attractive hallway light!"
—Daxiver, Izzet electromancer
grn97.title: Electrostatic Field

grn98.flavor:
"The League accepts no responsibility for former members and the damage they may cause."
—Maree, Izzet chamberlain
grn98.title: Erratic Cyclops

grn99.flavor: Turns out coffee is the weird aunt of invention.
grn99.title: Experimental Frenzy

grn100.flavor: "I spent some time in the Legion, but I'm done taking orders all day."
grn100.title: Fearless Halberdier

grn101.flavor: Rain runoff in the Smelting District is known to spontaneously burst into flame.
grn101.title: Fire Urchin

grn102.flavor: The Boros banner stands tall even if its bearer doesn't.
grn102.title: Goblin Banneret

grn104.flavor:
"He's got more finesse than most goblins. He smashes windows with his fist rather than his forehead."
—Arrester Polgar
grn104.title: Goblin Locksmith

grn106.flavor:
"They play by spitting fire at each other. Don't be offended if one gives you a love-scorch."
—Esfir, Rakdos dragon wrangler
grn106.title: Hellkite Whelp

grn107.flavor:
"The Izzet are blamed for every little disaster, which is unfair because we only cause most of them."
—Mizzix of the Izmagnus
grn107.title: Inescapable Blaze

grn108.flavor:
"Commander, we caught the Dimir spy and took her ashes into custody."
—Kramm, Wojek security officer
grn108.title: Lava Coil

grn110.flavor:
"They tell us the wilds are ours, then they brick them over. They can lie to our faces but not to our fists."
—Ghut Rak, Gruul guildmage
grn110.title: Maniacal Rage

grn112.flavor: "Nobody ever listens to my complaints! Not even when I use the listening stick."
grn112.title: Ornery Goblin

grn114.flavor: Some Gruul druids believe that boars are spawn of the great Ilharg, the mighty Raze-Boar who will one day rise and level the city.
grn114.title: Rubblebelt Boar

grn117.flavor:
"They said obey and you'll be happy. They said you'll be safe. But we're not safe. We're not happy. And we will not obey."
—Domri Rade
grn117.title: Street Riot

grn118.flavor: "I packed three more electroconduits into each test wand. You'll experience a brief tingling sensation."
grn118.title: Sure Strike

grn119.flavor: "Light a torch and deliver this letter" were his instructions, which he unfortunately reversed.
grn119.title: Torch Courier

grn120.flavor: "By all means, take another step toward the captain."
grn120.title: Wojek Bodyguard

grn121.flavor: The problem isn't the indrik's enthusiasm, it's Ravnica's lack of guardrails.
grn121.title: Affectionate Indrik

grn123.flavor: "The tiniest mouse speaks louder to me than all the festival crowds on Tin Street."
grn123.title: Beast Whisperer

grn124.flavor:
"I am the very soul of battle, but even I would never advise open war with the Conclave."
—Aurelia
grn124.title: Bounty of Might

grn125.flavor:
"The shortest path between two points is not always the safest."
—Tamina, district guide
grn125.title: Circuitous Route

grn126.flavor:
"The Dimir may look all they want. We never grow tired of swatting their bugs."
—Heruj, Selesnya hierophant
grn126.title: Crushing Canopy

grn127.flavor: "This is Mileva, in the Tenth. We've got an elf in the plaza with a chip on her shoulder. Actually, it's more of a morningstar."
grn127.title: Devkarin Dissident

grn128.flavor: "The route is direct but challenging. Incidentally, how are you with heights?"
grn128.title: District Guide

grn129.flavor: Cats place their gifts with care, so that a bare foot will step on them in the middle of the night.
grn129.title: Generous Stray

grn130.flavor: What the Golgari can't claim through patient undercity expansion, they seize in brazen topside sorties.
grn130.title: Golgari Raiders

grn131.flavor: Some rooftop gardens attract bees; others capture dragons.
grn131.title: Grappling Sundew

grn133.flavor: Nearly invisible strands of web reach far beyond its lair to alert it of the approach of prey.
grn133.title: Hitchclaw Recluse

grn134.flavor:
"Please don't feed the beetles."
—Promenade warning sign
grn134.title: Ironshell Beetle

grn135.flavor:
Feed on food, you eventually rot. Feed on rot, you live forever.
—Kraul saying
grn135.title: Kraul Foragers

grn137.flavor:
"There is nothing stronger than many hearts united for a single cause."
—Emmara
grn137.title: Might of the Masses

grn139.flavor: Selesnya grows its ranks in more ways than one.
grn139.title: Pack's Favor

grn142.flavor: Nature's way of saying "take the long way home."
grn142.title: Portcullis Vine

grn143.flavor:
"Light up the dark to find your way, and the dark may seek you out."
—Zalin the Gutter Bard
grn143.title: Prey Upon

grn144.flavor: Suddenly, all the haggling didn't seem so important.
grn144.title: Siege Wurm

grn146.flavor: Ravnica's diversity produces blossoms of opinion in a rich soil of perspectives.
grn146.title: Urban Utopia

grn148.flavor: Golgari crops bloom in strange soils, touched only by long-traveled light.
grn148.title: Vivid Revival

grn149.flavor:
"Be like the grazers of the Saruli. Keep your herd close, and stay alert for encroaching danger."
—Lalia, Selesnya dryad
grn149.title: Wary Okapi

grn150.flavor: Once part of a wealthy merchant's private zoo, the herd roams feral throughout the Tenth, where it will remain until the guilds can agree to relocate, cull, or befriend it.
grn150.title: Wild Ceratok

grn151.flavor: Dimir assassinations are choreographed like dance routines. Each challenge is anticipated and countered with graceful ease.
grn151.title: Artful Takedown

grn152.flavor: A power vacuum for the Azorius. A keepsake for Vraska.
grn152.title: Assassin's Trophy

grn156.flavor: "Send your champion. I could use a light workout."
grn156.title: Boros Challenger

grn157.flavor:
"Within the song of Mat'Selesnya, one becomes all."
—Heruj, Selesnya hierophant
grn157.title: Camaraderie

grn158.flavor: "Please accept this offering. I sincerely hope to leave my mace at my side."
grn158.title: Centaur Peacemaker

grn159.flavor: "It is not your time. The Legion still needs your blade."
grn159.title: Chance for Glory

grn161.flavor: "Just as leaves fall and the tree blooms again, one day I will fall and the Conclave will endure."
grn161.title: Conclave Cavalier

grn164.flavor: "I've seen your house, and you've been a lovely, if unwitting, host. But at last it's time for farewells."
grn164.title: Darkblade Agent

grn165.flavor:
"Commander, what's the signal to attack?"
"You'll know."
grn165.title: Deafening Clarion

grn166.flavor: Just assume every conversation is on record.
grn166.title: Dimir Spybug

grn167.flavor:
"People would sooner savor sweet lies than chew plain truths."
—Lazav
grn167.title: Disinformation Campaign

grn168.flavor: "Whatever hatred destroys, a single act of trust can revive."
grn168.title: Emmara, Soul of the Accord

grn169.flavor:
"The Erstwhile—rotten of body and outmoded in dress, but unfailing in loyalty."
—Vraska
grn169.title: Erstwhile Trooper

grn172.flavor: In the Legion, no flagpole is merely decorative, and every ceremonial sword bears an edge.
grn172.title: Garrison Sergeant

grn173.flavor: From death she grows living grandeur.
grn173.title: Glowspore Shaman

grn174.flavor:
"Result 752: Rapid mass redistribution.
"Result 753: Calamitous reverse synthesis.
"Result 754: Acute disarrayment."
—Izzet research notes
grn174.title: Goblin Electromancer

grn175.flavor: "We gather the past from surface dwellers and sell it right back to them."
grn175.title: Golgari Findbroker

grn176.flavor: Giants know a solid hit is one part strength, four parts leverage.
grn176.title: Hammer Dropper

grn178.flavor:
"It's like blowing up an arcane library in a thermobaric explosion. But in a good way."
—Bori Andon, Izzet blastseeker
grn178.title: Hypothesizzle

grn179.flavor: "Countermagic is a simple process of breaking matter into its elementary particles."
grn179.title: Ionize

grn181.flavor: "We are the shield that never breaks, the bough that never burns, the song that can never be silenced."
grn181.title: Join Shields

grn182.flavor:
"Those who show no mercy to the weak deserve no mercy from the strong."
—Firemane Kavrova
grn182.title: Justice Strike

grn188.flavor: "Our forces number more than the leaves of Vitu-Ghazi. Do not provoke us."
grn188.title: March of the Multitudes

grn191.flavor:
"Three daggers left in an angel's back, three enforcers with memory loss, three keys stolen from my own belt—and you talk of peace?"
—Tajic, to Aurelia
grn191.title: Nightveil Predator

grn193.flavor: City air is a constant drizzle of private thoughts.
grn193.title: Notion Rain

grn194.flavor: "The dagger is just the distraction. I carry the real killer in a vial at my side."
grn194.title: Ochran Assassin

grn196.flavor:
"The dead gain new purpose here. What is strange in the eyes of other guilds is harmonious in ours."
—Devesh, Golgari shaman
grn196.title: Rhizome Lurcher

grn197.flavor: "I long for peaceful times, when I may tend to my garden instead of our borders."
grn197.title: Rosemane Centaur

grn198.flavor: Squadrons of skyknights are available for deployment around the clock, capable of reaching any district in the city within minutes.
grn198.title: Skyknight Legionnaire

grn199.flavor: He heard stars and saw thunder.
grn199.title: Sonic Assault

grn202.flavor: "Now do you understand what we meant when we said disperse?" —Eksari, Boros patrol leader
grn202.title: Swathcutter Giant

grn203.flavor: A swiftblade is an artist, each fiery trail of their blades a fleeting masterpiece traced on the air.
grn203.title: Swiftblade Vindicator

grn206.flavor: "It's truly the highest honor, isn't it? To be remembered? Pity for you."
grn206.title: Thought Erasure

grn207.flavor: Ral's storm crackled with mystical detections: Planeswalkers were infiltrating Ravnica.
grn207.title: Thousand-Year Storm

grn212.flavor: A well-chosen word can restore a mind or snap its tethers.
grn212.title: Unmoored Ego

grn214.flavor:
"Something's causing electrospheric disruption in the blazekite's spire-vanes. Find the cause, and tell them to keep it up!"
—Juzba, Izzet tinker
grn214.title: Wee Dragonauts

grn216.flavor:
"Hold on to your ideals. They'll be tested more than your armor or the edge of your blade."
—Tajic
grn216.title: Fresh-Faced Recruit

grn217.flavor: Its hyperpneumatics can punch through a wall and the spy on the other side.
grn217.title: Piston-Fist Cyclops

grn218.flavor: "The reign of the Swarm begins. Let us rise now and dress ourselves in vengeance."
grn218.title: Pitiless Gorgon

grn219.flavor: "Selesnya's soil is sacred, and you're about to meet it with your face."
grn219.title: Vernadi Shieldmate

grn220.flavor: He has a job to finish, and it's you.
grn220.title: Whisper Agent

grn231.flavor:
"We pass these along to our fellow soldiers to recognize deeds of valor. It won't stay with you for long."
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage
grn231.title: Boros Locket

grn233.flavor: By guild tradition, any puddle of multicolored light on the cobblestones can serve as neutral ground.
grn233.title: Chromatic Lantern

grn234.flavor:
"Wear this, and take your place among the shadows—wise, lethal, and unseen."
—Ivrelya, Dimir spymaster
grn234.title: Dimir Locket

grn235.flavor: Each night it visits a different guildgate around the city, digging its talons into fresh stone.
grn235.title: Gatekeeper Gargoyle

grn237.flavor:
"Wear it at all times. It will guide our reanimators to your corpse."
—Mazirek, kraul death priest
grn237.title: Golgari Locket

grn238.flavor:
"Remember to discharge your locket every seven hours. Unless you prefer the spontaneous aether overload, of course."
—Daxiver, Izzet electromancer
grn238.title: Izzet Locket

grn239.flavor: "Be advised: suspect is nine stories tall, marble hair, answers to Saint Gusztav."
grn239.title: Rampaging Monument

grn240.flavor:
"Think of the locket as a seed you bear, spreading life from Vitu-Ghazi across all of Ravnica."
—Heruj, Selesnya hierophant
grn240.title: Selesnya Locket

grn241.flavor: "These terms are acceptable to House Dimir. Shall we shake on it?"
grn241.title: Silent Dart

grn242.flavor: Made by the mad for the work of the wicked.
grn242.title: Wand of Vertebrae

grn243.flavor:
"The more trust breaks down, the more we must throw open the front gates."
—Aurelia
grn243.title: Boros Guildgate

grn244.flavor:
"It is our duty to protect all those in need. But the other guilds have never shown themselves worthy of that protection."
—Tajic
grn244.title: Boros Guildgate

grn245.flavor:
"Every guild dreads infiltration. I should know—I've been a member of all of them."
—Lazav
grn245.title: Dimir Guildgate

grn246.flavor:
"You've found this place only because you were summoned. Pray you're worthy of the invitation."
—Etrata
grn246.title: Dimir Guildgate

grn247.flavor: The Chamber of the Guildpact stands as a reminder that even the bitterest struggles can end in cooperation.
grn247.title: Gateway Plaza

grn248.flavor:
"Shut the gates. In the Underrealm we will outlast the coming doom."
—Vraska
grn248.title: Golgari Guildgate

grn249.flavor:
"Jarad was a friend to the Devkarin. Now we slink through neglected tunnels, befriending those who crawl them."
—Izoni
grn249.title: Golgari Guildgate

grn251.flavor: Every laboratory buzzes with new experiments, each a piece of Ral's ambitious project.
grn251.title: Izzet Guildgate

grn252.flavor:
"Yesterday I didn't recognize my own guild. Today I see why. And for tomorrow I must be prepared."
—Niv-Mizzet
grn252.title: Izzet Guildgate

grn253.flavor: Cradle of the Golgari's new kingdom. Grave of those who wronged its queen.
grn253.title: Overgrown Tomb

grn254.flavor:
"You will not be trained here. You will be forged."
—Commander Yaszen
grn254.title: Sacred Foundry

grn255.flavor:
"Everyone who crosses that threshold is our most cherished friend. Everyone who crosses it again is our bitterest enemy."
—Trostani
grn255.title: Selesnya Guildgate

grn256.flavor:
"We leave our gardens open, so all may know wonder, but guarded, so all may know peace."
—Emmara
grn256.title: Selesnya Guildgate

grn257.flavor:
"A massive new Izzet building project with an unstated purpose? Probably fine."
—Zija, Simic mutationist
grn257.title: Steam Vents

grn258.flavor:
"Where the roots reach, there the temple rises."
—Niszka, Selesnya evangel
grn258.title: Temple Garden

grn259.flavor: Few believe Duskmantle exists. Fewer find it. None live to bear witness.
grn259.title: Watery Grave

grn267.flavor: Ral had wielded lightning all his life but had never harnessed the power of an entire guild.
grn267.title: Precision Bolt

grn270.flavor: The kraul once skulked in the outskirts of Golgari society, but with Vraska's rise, they became valued forces of the Swarm.
grn270.title: Kraul Raider

grn271.flavor: When the Erstwhile were unearthed from their tombs, they became a ready-made army for Vraska.
grn271.title: Attendant of Vraska

grn273.flavor: The ultimate answer to intrigue and subtlety.
grn273.title: Impervious Greatwurm

ana13.flavor: "Your death will be a balm, your passing a welcome revision, and all will sigh with peace to know of your demise."
ana13.title: Take Vengeance

ana6.flavor: "As long as my faith persists, so shall I."
ana6.title: Knight's Pledge

ana7.flavor: Loxodons are firm in stature and spirit. No matter the odds, they are always first into battle.
ana7.title: Loxodon Line Breaker

ana45.flavor: Sometimes an eruption in Shiv produces something more dangerous than a mere river of molten rock.
ana45.title: Volcanic Dragon

ana34.flavor:
"Death is no excuse for disobedience."
—Liliana Vess
ana34.title: Rise from the Grave

ana9.flavor: The angel remembers her past lives like dreams. Her song held up meadows. Her blade drove back darkness. Her wings carried her across the ages.
ana9.title: Serra Angel

ana36.flavor: The food chain doesn't end at sandwurms.
ana36.title: Chaos Maw

ana29.flavor: Its breath doesn't assault the senses. It pollutes the mind.
ana29.title: Miasmic Mummy

ana16.flavor: The truth came to Kumena like the Great River's torrent: the only way to keep his enemies away from the hidden city was to claim its power for himself.
ana16.title: Overflowing Insight

ana38.flavor: They fell screaming into the depths of the chasm like so many pebbles tossed down a well.
ana38.title: Earthquake

ana25.flavor:
"Conquering your first world is the hardest, after all. My power grew as I moved from world to world, taking anything that would make the next taking easier."
—Ob Nixilis
ana25.title: Ambition's Cost

ana32.flavor:
"I was not convinced you had a soul until I saw it for myself."
—Liliana Vess
ana32.title: Reave Soul

ana14.flavor:
"The key to unlocking this puzzle is within you."
—Doriel, mentor of Mistral Isle
ana14.title: Divination

ana47.flavor: In the dim light beneath the vast trees of Deepglade, baloths prowl in search of prey. Their guttural calls are more felt than heard, but their attack scream carries for miles.
ana47.title: Rumbling Baloth

ana41.flavor: Don't underestimate the aerodynamic qualities of the common goblin.
ana41.title: Goblin Grenade

ana33.flavor:
"Have you ever cornered a wounded vampire? That's a walk in the cathedral garden in comparison."
—Tristen, Cathar Marshal
ana33.title: Renegade Demon

ana8.flavor: Cats prowl the corridors of Avacyn's churches in search of devils or signs of their mischief.
ana8.title: Sanctuary Cat

ana15.flavor: Unbreakable and unappetizing, the crab grows uninterrupted, sometimes to the size of a cottage and beyond.
ana15.title: Fortress Crab

ana24.flavor:
"The demons don't care if we mutter niceties and act out ceremonies. Just kill him."
—Bishop Volpaig, servant of Griselbrand
ana24.title: Altar's Reap

ana28.flavor: Grixis is a world where the only things found in abundance are death and decay. Corpses, whole or in part, are the standard currency among necromancers and demons.
ana28.title: Fleshbag Marauder

ana27.flavor: Ugin's whispered summons led Sarkhan Vol to the moment that would echo down the centuries and seal Tarkir's fate: the primal battle between Ugin and Nicol Bolas.
ana27.title: Crux of Fate

ana44.flavor: The shaman opened the earth beneath their feet, trapping the survivors within the crevices of Ayagor for Atarka to devour at her leisure.
ana44.title: Seismic Rupture

ana21.flavor: Imitation is the most dangerous form of flattery.
ana21.title: Twincast

ana30.flavor: "It's not work if you enjoy it."
ana30.title: Murder

ana37.flavor: First the insult, then the encore.
ana37.title: Doublecast

rna2.flavor:
"If we cannot have peace, we will have justice."
—Aurelia
rna2.title: Angelic Exaltation

rna3.flavor: A ray of hope breaks through the shroud of rain.
rna3.title: Archway Angel

rna4.flavor: Law is the light of civilization.
rna4.title: Arrester's Zeal

rna5.flavor: "In you go, big guy. Watch your head."
rna5.title: Bring to Trial

rna6.flavor: "These are your streets. Defend them! This is your neighborhood. Honor it! This is your city. Save it!"
rna6.title: Civic Stalwart

rna7.flavor:
"What makes a frog lizard any worse than a bird horse? Prejudice against the Simic, that's what. It's unfair!"
—Thados Arquef, Guardian Project biomancer
rna7.title: Concordia Pegasus

rna8.flavor:
"Lies cannot long withstand the harsh light of day."
—Lavinia
rna8.title: Expose to Daylight

rna10.flavor: "You two, cover the alley! You, with me! Eyes on windows, balconies, and rooftops. Who knows what a fish-octopus-crab can do!"
rna10.title: Haazda Officer

rna11.flavor: When the established order falters, what remains are ordinary people and their struggle to survive.
rna11.title: Hero of Precinct One

rna12.flavor: In times of unrest, the crowd is eager for the comfort of strong convictions.
rna12.title: Impassioned Orator

rna13.flavor: With the new guildmaster's innovations, arresters can arrive on the scene moments before a crime is committed.
rna13.title: Justiciar's Portal

rna14.flavor: The helmet reveals no eyes to witness your penance, no mouth to offer absolution.
rna14.title: Knight of Sorrows

rna16.flavor: When the price of your sins comes due, the Church of Deals is there to collect.
rna16.title: Ministrant of Obligation

rna17.flavor: A hunter in the city requires the utmost cunning to survive. It must pounce only if the kill is certain, and leave the remains where no one will see.
rna17.title: Prowling Caracal

rna18.flavor: The guildmasters loom large in the political sphere, but in the end, the rulers of Ravnica are its people.
rna18.title: Rally to Battle

rna19.flavor: A friend in good times, a guardian in bad times, and a savior when all else fails.
rna19.title: Resolute Watchdog

rna21.flavor:
"If you can't control your mount, I will control it for you."
—Mirela, Azorius hussar
rna21.title: Sky Tether

rna23.flavor: She breathes fair winds to tired griffins and lifts songbirds beyond the reach of stalking cats.
rna23.title: Spirit of the Spires

rna24.flavor: Any challenge to Azorius authority is met with swift and potent retribution.
rna24.title: Summary Judgment

rna25.flavor:
"Many wings haunt the skies these days. Few of them bear good tidings."
—Lavinia
rna25.title: Syndicate Messenger

rna26.flavor: "I keep reminding myself we do this because others can't, because we love this city. If we don't save it, no one will."
rna26.title: Tenth District Veteran

rna28.flavor: A pet that can hunt both flesh and spirit is precious in a place where smiling assassins keep company with ghostly shadows.
rna28.title: Twilight Panther

rna30.flavor: Loitering is not only illegal but unwise, since those who stay too long in one place are apt to be stepped on.
rna30.title: Watchful Giant

rna31.flavor: Law is the voice of reason.
rna31.title: Arrester's Admonition

rna33.flavor: If you can see your breath, it's too late to run.
rna33.title: Chillbringer

rna34.flavor:
"The best way to keep a secret is to forget it."
—Lazav
rna34.title: Clear the Mind

rna36.flavor: Few Ravnicans are aware of the vast reefs in their world's hidden ocean. Far beneath the great sinkholes, where the light is blue and dim, merfolk tend the coral labyrinths that feed the benthic ecosystem.
rna36.title: Coral Commando

rna37.flavor:
"It's not enough to defeat our foes. We must learn from them, too."
—Vannifar
rna37.title: Essence Capture

rna39.flavor: Faeries are easily offended and quick to exact a quirky revenge.
rna39.title: Faerie Duelist

rna40.flavor: "I've been through every guildgate in this city, and no one sees me come or go."
rna40.title: Gateway Sneak

rna41.flavor: Searching the city for Fblthp felt like sifting the rain for a single drop of blood.
rna41.title: Humongulus

rna42.flavor: Those who cross the Dimir find enemies everywhere they turn.
rna42.title: Mass Manipulation

rna45.flavor: "To control the present we must master the future."
rna45.title: Precognitive Perception

rna46.flavor: "Citizen! Your crime has been recorded. Cease movement and await arrest, or further penalties will be immediately imposed."
rna46.title: Prying Eyes

rna48.flavor: "When properly invoked, the plasma globule encloses the offensive spell with a satisfying slurp."
rna48.title: Quench

rna49.flavor: The streets of Ravnica are full of former guild members now using their institutional skills for personal gain.
rna49.title: Sage's Row Savant

rna50.flavor:
"This Dovin Baan came from nowhere. Watch him. Read his letters. He is more than he appears."
—Lazav
rna50.title: Senate Courier

rna51.flavor:
"There's something peculiar about the rain today."
—Janoc, Tin Street tinker
rna51.title: Shimmer of Possibility

rna52.flavor:
"A better Ravnica begins with a better Simic."
—Vannifar
rna52.title: Skatewing Spy

rna53.flavor:
"Life has no mistakes, only experiments."
—Yolov, Simic bioengineer
rna53.title: Skitter Eel

rna54.flavor:
"Relax. It's quite harmless. And it will dissolve completely in a month or two."
—Navona, Simic field tester
rna54.title: Slimebind

rna55.flavor: "I do not understand the future I see: the guilds subverted, the world at war, armies bent to a cruel conqueror's will."
rna55.title: Sphinx of Foresight

rna57.flavor:
"I can think of no greater punishment than answering your question in full."
—Lazav
rna57.title: Thought Collapse

rna58.flavor:
"Here, there is only truth."
—Barvisa, Azorius emissary
rna58.title: Verity Circle

rna59.flavor: Those who intrude upon the Dimir seldom remember that they have done so.
rna59.title: Wall of Lost Thoughts

rna60.flavor: Drakes become especially voracious as they prepare for their autumn migration, hunting the city's thoroughfares from dawn to dusk.
rna60.title: Windstorm Drake

rna61.flavor: In preparation for the conflict all foresaw, the Golgari called upon an army that had slept for millennia beneath the city.
rna61.title: Awaken the Erstwhile

rna62.flavor: "Your spirits can rest in peace, for your debts are paid."
rna62.title: Bankrupt in Blood

rna64.flavor:
"The pain of searing iron and razor edges pales beside the pleasure of performance."
—Judith
rna64.title: Bladebrand

rna65.flavor: Blood seeks blood, and nothing shall hold back its hunger.
rna65.title: Bloodmist Infiltrator

rna66.flavor: No scrap of nutrition goes to waste in the undercity.
rna66.title: Carrion Imp

rna67.flavor:
"I am sewer-king!" said Rat. "I am quick and cunning and I know every tunnel."
"No, I am king!" said Zombie. "I am cold and deadly and no rot can harm me."
Then Croc came and ate them both.
rna67.title: Catacomb Crocodile

rna68.flavor: "Make way! It's time for the final act!"
rna68.title: Clear the Stage

rna69.flavor: First your whole life flashes before your eyes. Then you have considerable time to reflect on every regret as you plummet.
rna69.title: Consign to the Pit

rna70.flavor: If your ears bleed, it's a party. If your eyes bleed, it's a Rakdos party.
rna70.title: Cry of the Carnarium

rna71.flavor: You're only as dead as you feel.
rna71.title: Dead Revels

rna72.flavor: By design, the sarcophagus muffles the debtors' moans but does not silence them.
rna72.title: Debtors' Transport

rna74.flavor:
"No worthwhile reward is easily gained."
—Nicol Bolas
rna74.title: Font of Agonies

rna75.flavor:
"A debtor's soul has little value, except as a warning to others who might consider defaulting on their loans."
—Ubea, Orzhov ministrant
rna75.title: Grotesque Demise

rna77.flavor: "The suffering of others is not my concern."
rna77.title: Ill-Gotten Inheritance

rna78.flavor:
"Behold the groodion! Ichor-slurper, oozing fiend. Foulest wonder underground. Grandest vermin of them all!"
—Zalin the Gutter Bard
rna78.title: Noxious Groodion

rna79.flavor: "You'll pay what you owe, with your money or your life."
rna79.title: Orzhov Enforcer

rna81.flavor: Its stench corrodes steel. Its miasma sickens angels. Its finality ends hope.
rna81.title: Pestilent Spirit

rna82.flavor: For some goods, the best couriers are the dead.
rna82.title: Plague Wight

rna83.flavor: The Orzhov are not the only religious tradition on Ravnica, nor the oldest.
rna83.title: Priest of Forgotten Gods

rna84.flavor:
"The louder their performance, the quieter we become in comparison. They are the perfect distractions, for only fools ignore the Rakdos."
—Lazav
rna84.title: Rakdos Trumpeter

rna86.flavor: Its mandibles can leave a rider in the clouds astride a headless griffin.
rna86.title: Spire Mangler

rna87.flavor:
"Your life is a blinding light, your breath a gale, your pulse a deafening drum. Be still. Be still."
—Dahlya Trul, "Irbitov Lament"
rna87.title: Thirsting Shade

rna88.flavor:
"We grow strong by feasting on failure."
—Izoni
rna88.title: Undercity Scavenger

rna90.flavor: In theory, the Guildpact keeps guild feuds from spiraling out of control. Personal feuds, however, are not covered.
rna90.title: Vindictive Vampire

rna91.flavor: Seen through Rakdos eyes, a cruel betrayal is a hilarious stunt.
rna91.title: Act of Treason

rna93.flavor:
"From a great bonfire at the dawn of time, the first Gruul kindled their rage. The same flame burns in you."
—Kroshkar, Gruul shaman
rna93.title: Burn Bright

rna94.flavor: The ostentatious splendor of the Orzhov church was just asking to be smashed.
rna94.title: Burning-Tree Vandal

rna95.flavor: Let the Dimir worry about witnesses. For the Rakdos, screams count as applause.
rna95.title: Cavalcade of Calamity

rna97.flavor: "Keep coming. I have knives enough for everyone."
rna97.title: Dagger Caster

rna99.flavor: "Basically, we turn a bunch of little lightnings into one big lightning."
rna99.title: Electrodominance

rna100.flavor:
"Lost are the lush meadows and verdant forests, where maaka prowled and lammasu soared. Lost are the wilds, where our hearts were free."
—Daiva, Gruul storyteller
rna100.title: Feral Maaka

rna101.flavor: "Fire will cure a multitude of ills."
rna101.title: Flames of the Raze-Boar

rna102.flavor: When the Izzet's spirit of invention extends to the city's infrastructure, the results are sometimes explosive.
rna102.title: Gates Ablaze

rna103.flavor: "Today the Rubblebelt is a bit larger. That's a good day's work."
rna103.title: Ghor-Clan Wrecker

rna104.flavor: Two's a party. Three's a felony.
rna104.title: Goblin Gathering

rna105.flavor:
"No peace accord will save Ravnica. You don't build on rot. You burn it down and start again."
—Domri Rade
rna105.title: Gravel-Hide Goblin

rna110.flavor: Gruul oracles see omens in all forms of destruction: the entrails of a maaka's prey, the flight of vultures over a battlefield, the scattering of toppled stone.
rna110.title: Rubble Reading

rna111.flavor: Joining a guild, even the Gruul, would mean giving up some of his independence. He'd rather smash what he wants to smash.
rna111.title: Rubblebelt Recluse

rna113.flavor: "Have you seen your face? Trust me, this will be an improvement."
rna113.title: Scorchmark

rna115.flavor: Going to a Rakdos show is dangerous. Trying to leave early can be fatal.
rna115.title: Skewer the Critics

rna117.flavor:
"Don't waste time aiming, you lazy gob-slug! Fire!"
—Krenko, mob boss
rna117.title: Spear Spewer

rna118.flavor: "Every street's a stage, and every screaming bystander's an audience."
rna118.title: Spikewheel Acrobat

rna119.flavor: "My shout is thunder and my fist is lightning!"
rna119.title: Storm Strike

rna120.flavor: "That giant didn't even see me, let alone catch me! And I was close enough to smell him! Of course, that's not saying much."
rna120.title: Tin Street Dodger

rna121.flavor:
"Imagine a gigantic pine cone that's extremely territorial and always in a foul mood."
—Zhosmir, urban huntmaster
rna121.title: Axebane Beast

rna123.flavor:
"To survive exceptional times we must adapt by exceptional means."
—Vannifar
rna123.title: Biogenic Upgrade

rna125.flavor: "There's no time to calm it down! Run!"
rna125.title: Enraged Ceratok

rna126.flavor: So-called "battering rams" pale in comparison to the real thing.
rna126.title: Gatebreaker Ram

rna127.flavor:
"When the sky screams, when the ground groans, the End-Raze will soon begin."
—Nikya of the Old Ways
rna127.title: Gift of Strength

rna130.flavor: Simic's strength comes from its diversity.
rna130.title: Guardian Project

rna132.flavor:
"The good news is that the migrating drakes are no longer a problem."
—Bell Migellic, Azorius hussar
rna132.title: Mammoth Spider

rna133.flavor:
"If you don't have a destination in mind, the route is all that matters."
—Tamina, district guide
rna133.title: Open the Gates

rna134.flavor: "Rage! Rage until the whole world burns!"
rna134.title: Rampage of the Clans

rna136.flavor:
"When you get right down to it, the difference between death and life is just a membrane-enclosed environment maintained by a metabolic process."
—Gulistan, Simic biomancer
rna136.title: Regenesis

rna137.flavor: The roots run deep under stone and street, with strength that needs but a whisper to awaken.
rna137.title: Root Snare

rna138.flavor:
"My bowstring hums in tune with the song of the Worldsoul."
—Alcarus, Selesnya sagittar
rna138.title: Sagittars' Volley

rna139.flavor: "I hold the seed of our new beginning."
rna139.title: Saruli Caretaker

rna140.flavor:
"Within each of us, the potential for great power waits to be released."
—Zija, Simic mutationist
rna140.title: Sauroform Hybrid

rna141.flavor: "Stay close! It's just a little farther."
rna141.title: Silhana Wayfinder

rna142.flavor:
"If the Fin Clade cannot produce a reliable venomous krasis, mobile in both air and water, then the Guardian Project will absorb its resources."
—Vannifar
rna142.title: Steeple Creeper

rna143.flavor: "What you build, we will destroy . . . and bury you in the rubble!"
rna143.title: Stony Strength

rna144.flavor: The mournful lowing of brushstriders warns of changing weather and ill winds.
rna144.title: Sylvan Brushstrider

rna145.flavor:
"The presence of the strong will make you stronger."
—Yeva, Nature's Herald
rna145.title: Territorial Boar

rna147.flavor:
"We've been practicing for this all our lives. This is the final test!"
—Korun Nar, Rubblebelt hunter
rna147.title: Tower Defense

rna149.flavor:
"Walls crack. Buildings fall. Always the wilds return."
—Domri Rade
rna149.title: Wilderness Reclamation

rna150.flavor:
"The best construction makes the most satisfying destruction."
—Domri Rade
rna150.title: Wrecking Beast

rna151.flavor: "In your misguided attempt to subvert the law, you have eloquently explained why the law must exist."
rna151.title: Absorb

rna152.flavor:
"The absence of binocular vision imposes certain challenges for a flying creature, which are overcome via echolocation."
—Simic research notes
rna152.title: Aeromunculus

rna154.flavor: Thanks to the magic in his Writ of Passage, alms beasts lumbered aside, anarchs bowed their heads, and even Rakdos acrobats rolled their spikewheels out of his way.
rna154.title: Azorius Knight-Arbiter

rna155.flavor: "These new thopters are all well and good, but four eyes are better than none."
rna155.title: Azorius Skyguard

rna156.flavor: You can hear their tolling only when your debt is due.
rna156.title: Basilica Bell-Haunt

rna157.flavor:
"It's easy to get taken in by the spectacle, to enjoy a bit of naughty amusement. But make no mistake: the Cult of Rakdos is a danger."
—Tajic
rna157.title: Bedevil

rna159.flavor: Jaharg discovered that the shapes and symmetries so pleasing to the sculptor's eye also yielded a well-balanced bludgeon.
rna159.title: Bolrac-Clan Crusher

rna168.flavor: Dovin ticked the Planeswalkers off on his fingers: himself, Domri, Kaya, Ral, Vraska . . . and Bolas made an even six.
rna168.title: Dovin's Acuity

rna170.flavor:
"Time to let the dead be dead."
—Kaya, to Teysa
rna170.title: Ethereal Absolution

rna171.flavor: There's nothing quite like the feeling of paying off a large debt.
rna171.title: Final Payment

rna172.flavor: "Let's find out what kind of audience you are. Festive? Fearless?"
rna172.title: Fireblade Artist

rna175.flavor:
"I might have overfed him."
—Gulistan, Simic biomancer
rna175.title: Galloping Lizrog

rna176.flavor:
"Vraska sees the grandeur in death but misses the hilarity."
—Judith
rna176.title: Get the Point

rna177.flavor: "Debt due! Debt due!" The thrull's screeching makes children flinch and debtors quail. "Debt due!"
rna177.title: Grasping Thrull

rna178.flavor: Cyclical and spiral patterns are the specialty of the Gyre Clade, which seeks to revitalize the cycles of nature.
rna178.title: Growth Spiral

rna179.flavor: She displays her scars with pride.
rna179.title: Gruul Spellbreaker

rna180.flavor: "As I contemplate what is, I dive ever deeper into the depths of possibility. Then I set an experiment in motion and watch the truth rise to the surface."
rna180.title: Gyre Engineer

rna181.flavor: "They all want to see me fall."
rna181.title: Hackrobat

rna183.flavor: Havoc is a small price to pay for data.
rna183.title: Hydroid Krasis

rna184.flavor: The rights of ghosts are strictly protected under Orzhov bylaws, and those who enforce them can count on the ghosts' assistance.
rna184.title: Imperious Oligarch

rna185.flavor: At the end of the show, she stands alone on a stage brilliant with blood.
rna185.title: Judith, the Scourge Diva

rna187.flavor: Teysa convened the meeting of the Obzedat. Kaya ended it.
rna187.title: Kaya's Wrath

rna189.flavor: "I told Jace that Ravnica would fall apart if he didn't take his responsibilities seriously. I didn't want to be right."
rna189.title: Lavinia, Azorius Renegade

rna193.flavor: "The hooves of the Raze-Boar will trample the weak—and their city—to dust!"
rna193.title: Nikya of the Old Ways

rna194.flavor: "Pay in gold. Pay in blood. Pay with the servitude of your spirit kin. But pay you must."
rna194.title: Pitiless Pontiff

rna197.flavor: Ever wonder why you never see an old Rakdos cultist?
rna197.title: Rakdos Firewheeler

rna198.flavor:
"That one has a bright future—perfect instincts for the rhythm of mayhem."
—Judith
rna198.title: Rakdos Roustabout

rna201.flavor: Some view Domri's unlikely ascent as a sign of Ilharg the Raze-Boar's imminent return.
rna201.title: Rhythm of the Wild

rna202.flavor: The sly, stealthy warriors of the Slizt Clan survive by hiding in high ground and ambushing their enemies. Other Gruul call them skulkers and cowards, but only from a safe distance.
rna202.title: Rubblebelt Runner

rna203.flavor: A Gruul berserker is never unarmed.
rna203.title: Savage Smash

rna208.flavor: Azorius sphinxes are loyal to the precepts of the law, not to any particular guildmaster—even one of their own kind.
rna208.title: Sphinx of New Prahv

rna209.flavor: "Do not think me blind to your true mission . . . or your true master, Grand Arbiter."
rna209.title: Sphinx's Insight

rna210.flavor: "You take our wilds, we take your city."
rna210.title: Sunder Shaman

rna212.flavor: While Kaya is guildmaster, Teysa waits patiently at the center of the Orzhov web of power.
rna212.title: Teysa Karlov

rna215.flavor: Among the Zhur-Taa Clan, goblins are the first to enter battlefury. When the battle is over, the survivors are still frothing at the mouth, looking for someone to hit.
rna215.title: Zhur-Taa Goblin

rna216.flavor:
"This footlight's broken. Get me a stagehand!"
—Judith
rna216.title: Footlight Fiend

rna217.flavor:
"Tear down the city, lie by lie. Then throw it back at the liars, stone by stone."
—Domri Rade
rna217.title: Rubble Slinger

rna219.flavor:
"The Senate griffins overhead used to make people think of order and safety. Not anymore."
—Lavinia
rna219.title: Senate Griffin

rna220.flavor: Orzhov vampires look for allies in unlikely places in case their new guildmaster turns on them. The fate of the Obzedat is proof of Kaya's power and her hatred of the living dead.
rna220.title: Vizkopa Vampire

rna231.flavor:
"Mandatory lockets enable the tracking of all Senate personnel for improved security and efficiency."
—Dovin Baan
rna231.title: Azorius Locket

rna233.flavor:
"Counterbalanced forces sustain this city. No faction above others. A beautiful idea."
—Emmara
rna233.title: Glass of the Guildpact

rna234.flavor:
"In life, it was a cunning survivor, fearless and quick. May its power pass to you who as you wear its skull."
—Gna, Gruul shaman
rna234.title: Gruul Locket

rna235.flavor:
"Hey, wait! That's my boot!"
—Darijo, Ivy Street ruffian
rna235.title: Junktroller

rna236.flavor:
"It looks expensive, doesn't it? You have no idea . . ."
—Milana, Orzhov prelate
rna236.title: Orzhov Locket

rna237.flavor:
"This trinket will gain you admittance to some painfully exclusive gatherings."
—Exava, blood witch
rna237.title: Rakdos Locket

rna238.flavor: Feed it steel. Feed it gold. Feed it bone. In the belly of the furnace, the flames know no difference.
rna238.title: Scrabbling Claws

rna240.flavor:
"Like our guild itself, this locket can stand for many things. You must discern what it means for you."
—Vannifar
rna240.title: Simic Locket

rna242.flavor:
"Reading it has given me a glimpse of what makes this deeply flawed city so very magnificent."
—Dovin Baan
rna242.title: Tome of the Guildpact

rna243.flavor:
"If the populace fears our authority, then I'd say we have an appropriately sensible populace."
—Dovin Baan
rna243.title: Azorius Guildgate

rna244.flavor:
"If you want to know what's really going on in any building, you don't walk in the front door. You stake out the back."
—Lavinia
rna244.title: Azorius Guildgate

rna245.flavor: Life is a show, and death its final performance.
rna245.title: Blood Crypt

rna247.flavor: The Chamber of the Guildpact has fallen silent, its bright promise broken.
rna247.title: Gateway Plaza

rna248.flavor: Sin is debt, and absolution is paid in tithes of gold and blood.
rna248.title: Godless Shrine

rna249.flavor:
"Beyond this gate there are no citizens, only predators and prey."
—Domri Rade
rna249.title: Gruul Guildgate

rna250.flavor:
"Old turf. Powerful turf. Much good blood spilled here."
—Ruric Thar
rna250.title: Gruul Guildgate

rna251.flavor: The ever-watchful center of a growing web of eyes.
rna251.title: Hallowed Fountain

rna252.flavor:
"So much wealth. So much splendor. So much temptation to believe the gilded lie."
—Kaya
rna252.title: Orzhov Guildgate

rna253.flavor:
"If you think the cathedral is impressive, you should see what's down below."
—Teysa
rna253.title: Orzhov Guildgate

rna255.flavor:
"My servants take pains for your pleasure, and take pleasure in your pain!"
—Rakdos
rna255.title: Rakdos Guildgate

rna256.flavor:
"Slip in the back if you don't want to be recognized. Don't worry—we'll make sure you're never found!"
—Judith
rna256.title: Rakdos Guildgate

rna257.flavor:
"Mystery is beauty. Within the unknown we plumb revelation."
—Vannifar
rna257.title: Simic Guildgate

rna258.flavor:
"When the Prime Speaker goes too far, I will be here in the safety of the deeps to correct her."
—Zegana
rna258.title: Simic Guildgate

rna259.flavor:
"What we begin, the End-Raze will finish. Then we will dance in Ravnica's rubble."
—Nikya of the Old Ways
rna259.title: Stomping Ground

rna266.flavor: "Hold it! I need to see your papers."
rna266.title: Elite Arrester

rna268.flavor: It was made for battle, but that doesn't mean it's unsophisticated.
rna268.title: Dovin's Automaton

rna270.flavor: "Your precious laws can't save you now!"
rna270.title: Ragefire
