thb17.flavor: "We are bearers of the ancient light, keepers of sun-crowned Heliod's blessings. Fight, and the light will protect you!"
thb17.title: Glory Bearers

thb19.flavor: "I bring a dawn that no night can follow."
thb19.title: Heliod's Intervention

thb22.flavor: Leonin fight for neither god nor polis; their loyalty is to their pride.
thb22.title: Hero of the Pride

thb23.flavor: To tame a griffin is to ride into legend.
thb23.title: Hero of the Winds

thb25.flavor:
"Charge bravely. Fight selflessly. Act honorably. Iroas will watch over you."
—Verenis, priest of Iroas
thb25.title: Indomitable Will

thb27.flavor: "Our stories are full of ancient wisdom; they tell us who we are."
thb27.title: Lagonna-Band Storyteller

thb28.flavor: Leonin band together in the Underworld, taking solace in their strength until, at last, both pride and self are forgotten.
thb28.title: Leonin of the Lost Pride

thb29.flavor: "Storms drove them westward to Ketaphos; wide plains shimmered in starlight. Centaurs greeted them, offering gold-hued apples and grain-cakes." —The Callapheia
thb29.title: Nyxborn Courser

thb30.flavor: "My time will come, when every soul will bask in my glory and obey my law."
thb30.title: Omen of the Sun

thb31.flavor: Every soldier has a place to stand and a role to play.
thb31.title: Phalanx Tactics

thb32.flavor: Every footstep is a prayer, every road a temple.
thb32.title: Pious Wayfarer

thb33.flavor: "Zeal is the sharpest blade, and piety the strongest shield."
thb33.title: Reverent Hoplite

thb34.flavor:
"The time has come for us to throw off the chains of tyrannical gods and antiquated superstitions."
—Tikaia, disciple of Uremides
thb34.title: Revoke Existence

thb35.flavor:
"To provoke the mountain is to invite the avalanche."
—Perisophia the philosopher
thb35.title: Rumbling Sentry

thb37.flavor: When the gods go to war, mortals pay the highest price.
thb37.title: Shatter the Sky

thb38.flavor: Chosen by Heliod, Daxos approached the pegasus without fear, and rode it without saddle or reins.
thb38.title: Sunmane Pegasus

thb39.flavor: "I like to think Kytheon keeps watch over all of us."
thb39.title: Taranika, Akroan Veteran

thb40.flavor: "The first griffins were made by the gods to capture falling stars; they were given the keenest eyes and the swiftest wings, and sent to keep watch above the clouds." —The Cosmogony
thb40.title: Transcendent Envoy

thb41.flavor: Not even death can quench a hero's inner fire.
thb41.title: Triumphant Surge

thb42.flavor: "Why would I ever want to look away?"
thb42.title: Alirios, Enraptured

thb44.flavor: The oracles of Meletis foresaw neither its rise from the depths nor the destruction it would leave in its wake.
thb44.title: Brine Giant

thb46.flavor: Those who do not learn from their mistakes are bound to relive them.
thb46.title: Chain to Memory

thb47.flavor: "A great wave crashed, and a mighty wind blew out the stars." —The Cosmogony
thb47.title: Deny the Divine

thb48.flavor: "And what did Erekastos teach us is the nature of the soul?"
thb48.title: Eidolon of Philosophy

thb49.flavor: The greatest minds in Meletis study under the masters at the Dekatia, a renowned school of magic and philosophy.
thb49.title: Elite Instructor

thb50.flavor:
"Freedom lies in accepting a single path."
—Nyklos, Meletian philosopher
thb50.title: Glimpse of Freedom

thb51.flavor: Tycthis's military career was a flop.
thb51.title: Ichthyomorphosis

thb54.flavor: Alythos sat and stared blankly out over the glassy oceans of Nerono, trying in vain to remember what he knew he had forgotten.
thb54.title: Memory Drain

thb56.flavor:
"Wave-borne, he watches over secrets of the shore."
—Psemilla, Meletian poet
thb56.title: Naiad of Hidden Coves

thb57.flavor: "Storm-tossed and broken, Callaphe cried out to deep-dwelling Thassa. Tritons came swiftly to save her, bringing her north to the Lindus." —The Callapheia
thb57.title: Nyxborn Seaguard

thb58.flavor: "My time will come, when the rising tide will surge above the tallest mountain."
thb58.title: Omen of the Sea

thb59.flavor:
"Take your place among the stars."
—Kruphix, god of horizons
thb59.title: One with the Stars

thb60.flavor: "Once you see past the veil we call ʻreality,' altering your own shape is elementary."
thb60.title: Protean Thaumaturge

thb61.flavor: "As the storm waves crushed my sailors, I cried out to Thassa. The next time I saw them, hard shells encased them, and they swam away to safety." —Siona, captain of the Pyleas
thb61.title: Riptide Turtle

thb62.flavor: "I see destruction, suffering, and one tormented glimmer of hope."
thb62.title: Sage of Mysteries

thb63.flavor: Instead of performing their daily devotions, Heliod's acolytes spent the morning picking strands of kelp off the altar.
thb63.title: Sea God's Scorn

thb64.flavor: It swims upon the winds and soars through the waves.
thb64.title: Shimmerwing Chimera

thb65.flavor: It eats the things that eat the things that are drawn to the light.
thb65.title: Shoal Kraken

thb66.flavor: Normally, a cerberus sleeps one head at a time.
thb66.title: Sleep of the Dead

thb68.flavor: Cities offer tribute to Ephara and carve her image into their walls, imploring her to protect them from the dangers of the wild.
thb68.title: Stern Dismissal

thb70.flavor: When memory is torment, oblivion is bliss.
thb70.title: Sweet Oblivion

thb72.flavor: "I bring a flood that nothing can withstand."
thb72.title: Thassa's Intervention

thb74.flavor: A sip of recollection, an ocean of regrets.
thb74.title: Thirst for Meaning

thb76.flavor: Even in their mountain fortresses, the Akroans have learned not to anger Thassa.
thb76.title: Thryx, the Sudden Storm

thb77.flavor: Thassa's favor followed him to the Underworld. Even the waves of Nerono obeyed his will.
thb77.title: Towering-Wave Mystic

thb78.flavor: "You can no more stop me than you can halt the tide."
thb78.title: Triton Waverider

thb79.flavor:
"May the skies be clear of gales and gulls."
—Meletian prayer
thb79.title: Vexing Gull

thb80.flavor: Tritons search for omens in its wake.
thb80.title: Wavebreak Hippocamp

thb82.flavor: "As the future slips its way into the present, it ceases to be my concern."
thb82.title: Witness of Tomorrows

thb83.flavor: The sharp memory of Daxos's death stabbed into Elspeth's soul.
thb83.title: Agonizing Remorse

thb84.flavor:
"Sing, beauty. Sing for death, and for the dead."
—Ashiok
thb84.title: Aphemia, the Cacophony

thb85.flavor: "Some aspire to be mighty like the lion or the hydra. I am the parasite that feeds on them all."
thb85.title: Aspect of Lamprey

thb86.flavor: Wherever it walks, famine follows behind.
thb86.title: Blight-Breath Catoblepas

thb87.flavor: In bleak Tizerus, all hope crumbles in your grasp.
thb87.title: Cling to Dust

thb89.flavor: The more you struggle against death, the tighter its grip becomes.
thb89.title: Drag to the Underworld

thb90.flavor:
"Kroxa devours what he may—not for sustenance or pleasure, but because it is his nature. He is unending hunger given form."
—Klothys, god of destiny
thb90.title: Eat to Extinction

thb92.flavor:
"Evil flourishes where ignorance thrives."
—Perisophia the philosopher
thb92.title: Enemy of Enlightenment

thb94.flavor: "I bring a death none can escape."
thb94.title: Erebos's Intervention

thb95.flavor: The Underworld erodes memory, identity, and eventually the physical form, leaving only crumbling statues called misera—hollow monuments to mortal futility.
thb95.title: Final Death

thb96.flavor: One spiny tree with bitter fruit grows in the realm of Tizerus, outside the palace of Erebos.
thb96.title: Fruit of Tizerus

thb97.flavor: Funerary masks help the newly dead resist the erosion of memory and identity in the Underworld.
thb97.title: Funeral Rites

thb100.flavor: The Returned retain no memory of their identities, but sometimes they mindlessly attempt familiar tasks.
thb100.title: Grim Physician

thb101.flavor: From the echoes of a violent life, a terrible foe is born.
thb101.title: Hateful Eidolon

thb102.flavor:
"How many more will die before you accept your fate?"
—Erebos, god of the dead
thb102.title: Inevitable End

thb103.flavor:
"Grief-struck, she weeps for each mortal's final death."
—Psemilla, Meletian poet
thb103.title: Lampad of Death's Vigil

thb104.flavor: As a mortal, Phenax was the first to escape the Underworld. As a god, he brings his pawns along the same dark path.
thb104.title: Minion's Return

thb105.flavor: Caught between life and death, between land and sea, between thought and oblivion.
thb105.title: Mire Triton

thb106.flavor: Those caught attempting to escape the Underworld spend the rest of their existence trapped in the Mire of Punishment.
thb106.title: Mire's Grasp

thb107.flavor: Rage-crowned Mogis swiftly rewards the virtue of brutality.
thb107.title: Mogis's Favor

thb109.flavor: "Callaphe guided them into the darkness of Hetos, the bleak mire; Blood-horned minotaurs circled them, axes aglimmer in shadow." —The Callapheia
thb109.title: Nyxborn Marauder

thb110.flavor: "My time will come, when life's frantic striving will fade into the boundless quiet of death."
thb110.title: Omen of the Dead

thb111.flavor: "If you will not pour your drink out for me, I shall pour mine out for you."
thb111.title: Pharika's Libation

thb113.flavor: The fury of the slaughter god Mogis burns within him.
thb113.title: Rage-Scarred Berserker

thb114.flavor: Desecrating the dead is a convenient way for harpies to expand their foul collections.
thb114.title: Scavenging Harpy

thb115.flavor: "We offer to Mogis the blood of the weak, and in return he makes us strong."
thb115.title: Soulreaper of Mogis

thb116.flavor: "I don't know if the gods watch over their temples, but I figure it's best to be stealthy just in case."
thb116.title: Temple Thief

thb117.flavor: Phenax is generous with gifts and unforgiving of debts.
thb117.title: Treacherous Blessing

thb121.flavor: Dreams are just one more form of torment.
thb121.title: Underworld Dreams

thb122.flavor: "Many have sought snake-twined Pharika's panacea. Do you wish to share their fate?"
thb122.title: Venomous Hierophant

thb126.flavor: "It's not enough to surprise your opponent. You have to delight the crowd as well."
thb126.title: Arena Trickster

thb128.flavor: It's a small step from revel to bloodbath.
thb128.title: Blood Aspirant

thb129.flavor: "Renata was mesmerized by the satyr's dance of gleeful indifference, of reckless grace and bright disaster." —Luphea of Setessa, Histories
thb129.title: Careless Celebrant

thb130.flavor: Magic is the true artist's medium.
thb130.title: Dreamshaper Shaman

thb131.flavor: Purphoros forged the manticore's tail from bronze, its teeth from silver, and its heart from hate.
thb131.title: Dreamstalker Manticore

thb132.flavor: "Not even death can catch me now!"
thb132.title: Escape Velocity

thb133.flavor:
"Everything will be put back in its proper place."
—Klothys, god of destiny
thb133.title: Fateful End

thb134.flavor: Those who fought without honor in life are taken to Agonas and doomed to fight forever in its arenas.
thb134.title: Final Flare

thb135.flavor:
"A cyclops thinks slowly but strikes quickly. Try to keep it thinking."
—Brigone, soldier of Meletis
thb135.title: Flummoxed Cyclops

thb136.flavor: Klothys set out to mend the destiny of Theros, her fury guiding every stitch.
thb136.title: Furious Rise

thb137.flavor: Winners of the Iroan Games are forever remembered as heroes of their people.
thb137.title: Hero of the Games

thb138.flavor: Brashness is close enough to bravery.
thb138.title: Heroes of the Revel

thb139.flavor: "Feast, for your next meal may be your last!"
thb139.title: Impending Doom

thb140.flavor: The flamespeakers of Akros live passionately, devoted to Purphoros and the cycle of destructive creation.
thb140.title: Incendiary Oracle

thb141.flavor: "Renata launched a dozen arrows into the minotaur's thick hide, but the monster didn't slow its charge. The fury of Mogis was upon it." —Luphea of Setessa, Histories
thb141.title: Infuriate

thb142.flavor: The blessing is not the strength itself, but the knowledge of how to use it.
thb142.title: Iroas's Blessing

thb143.flavor: To some satyrs, only blasphemy is sacred.
thb143.title: Irreverent Revelers

thb144.flavor: "One-eyed and frightful, the cyclops lifted a boulder and hurled it seaward from cliff's edge, shattering masts and scattering sailors." —The Callapheia
thb144.title: Nyxborn Brute

thb145.flavor: "My time will come, when all the world will be reforged in the fires of my invention."
thb145.title: Omen of the Forge

thb146.flavor:
"Flame-wrapped, she dances a burning swath amid the clouds."
—Psemilla, Meletian poet
thb146.title: Oread of Mountain's Blaze

thb149.flavor: Mogis can fan a small flame of resentment into an inferno of madness.
thb149.title: Portent of Betrayal

thb151.flavor: "I bring a fire to recast all the world."
thb151.title: Purphoros's Intervention

thb152.flavor: It's hard to keep a satyr down, even in the Underworld.
thb152.title: Satyr's Cunning

thb154.flavor: The minotaur polis of Skophos boasts grand temples to the god of slaughter.
thb154.title: Skophos Warleader

thb155.flavor: To a satyr, a stampede is just another kind of revelry.
thb155.title: Stampede Rider

thb157.flavor: Distant thunder rumbled, a dread forewarning of Keranos's displeasure.
thb157.title: Storm's Wrath

thb159.flavor: "Right now, in these first moments of creation, it is simultaneously nothing and everything."
thb159.title: Thrill of Possibility

thb162.flavor: The Underworld is anything but a resting place.
thb162.title: Underworld Fires

thb164.flavor: Bright flames quell the darkest nightmares.
thb164.title: Wrap in Flames

thb165.flavor: Her webs, spun from her own hair, reach from Nyx to the mortal world and even into the Underworld.
thb165.title: Arasta of the Endless Web

thb169.flavor:
"Vine-wreathed, he nurtures life among the dead."
—Psemilla, Meletian poet
thb169.title: Dryad of the Ilysian Grove

thb171.flavor: The Nessian Wood is never without defenders.
thb171.title: Gift of Strength

thb173.flavor: The scouts of Hyrax Tower keep watch at the edge of Setessan territory, protecting the polis from inhuman monsters and enemy armies.
thb173.title: Hyrax Tower Scout

thb174.flavor: Those who die as heroes are permitted to dwell in Ilysia, a protected realm of the Underworld as tranquil and vibrant as the rest is bleak.
thb174.title: Ilysian Caryatid

thb175.flavor: Nylea appeared amid the howl of a hundred beasts.
thb175.title: Inspire Awe

thb176.flavor: The god of destiny grants her followers vision deeper than sight.
thb176.title: Klothys's Design

thb177.flavor:
"I see . . . elk? And lion? And . . . teeth! A lot of teeth!"
—Teraklos of Meletis
thb177.title: Loathsome Chimera

thb178.flavor:
"Be fearless, for a furious rebirth awaits you."
—Nylea, god of the hunt
thb178.title: Mantle of the Wolf

thb179.flavor: Nylea watches over all the creatures of the forest except for the snakes. Blessed by Pharika, they can take care of themselves.
thb179.title: Moss Viper

thb180.flavor:
"No power is too great to be undone."
—Karametra, god of harvests
thb180.title: Mystic Repeal

thb181.flavor: Renata led the best hunters in all of Theros on a quest to bring down the terror of the Setessan wilds.
thb181.title: Nessian Boar

thb182.flavor:
"The first rule of politics can be learned from a lowly hornbeetle: it is wise to cultivate powerful friends."
—Pythamon, sage of Meletis
thb182.title: Nessian Hornbeetle

thb184.flavor: The Summer Nexus is a holy grove in Setessa where the starfields of Nyx glitter in the shadows.
thb184.title: Nexus Wardens

thb186.flavor: Where its feet tread, the thunder of many others will follow.
thb186.title: Nylea's Forerunner

thb187.flavor: Nature is stillness and savagery in equal measure.
thb187.title: Nylea's Huntmaster

thb188.flavor: "I bring a wilderness no law can tame."
thb188.title: Nylea's Intervention

thb189.flavor: "A piercing call, bright as the stars, rang out across the valley, calling the Pheres band to war, to blood and savagery." —Luphea of Setessa, Histories
thb189.title: Nyx Herald

thb190.flavor: Ancient yet ever-young, it is wise and subtle—and cruel and reckless as the spring itself.
thb190.title: Nyxbloom Ancient

thb191.flavor: "Tree-tall giants confronted her, fiercely demanding her tribute; Fox-cunning Callaphe's slippery speaking entangled their senses . . ." —The Callapheia
thb191.title: Nyxborn Colossus

thb192.flavor: "My time will come, when no road will divide the endless verdure of the trees."
thb192.title: Omen of the Hunt

thb194.flavor: An arrow from Nylea's bow never fails to find its mark.
thb194.title: Plummet

thb195.flavor: Calix was patient, steadily following Elspeth until their destined confrontation.
thb195.title: Relentless Pursuit

thb197.flavor: "Far-seeing Kruphix glimpsed the end: Heliod's spear cast down and broken." —The Cosmogony
thb197.title: Return to Nature

thb198.flavor: "A blessing is not a gift. It is a duty."
thb198.title: Setessan Champion

thb199.flavor: "Cypress leaves for family, larkspur for protection, amaranth for a bountiful harvest."
thb199.title: Setessan Petitioner

thb200.flavor: Bassara, the tower of the fox, houses the elite skirmishers who guard the Nessian Wood against trespassers.
thb200.title: Setessan Skirmisher

thb201.flavor: In the heart of Setessa, the warriors of Leina Tower defend the polis and train its daughters.
thb201.title: Setessan Training

thb202.flavor: "From the ashes of last night's revel, I bring the dawn of new growth."
thb202.title: Skola Grovedancer

thb203.flavor: A typhon's escape from the Underworld makes armies flee and kingdoms fall.
thb203.title: Voracious Typhon

thb206.flavor: The best healers are intimately familiar with death.
thb206.title: Acolyte of Affliction

thb207.flavor: The light of hope blinded Pantor to the ills of the world.
thb207.title: Allure of the Unknown

thb212.flavor: His imagination soars from the depths of the sea to the heights of the heavens.
thb212.title: Dalakos, Crafter of Wonders

thb213.flavor: It slips silently through the still waters of the Labyrinth of Memories to feed.
thb213.title: Devourer of Memory

thb216.flavor: Nylea speaks to her in the windblown leaves; Thassa in the rushing tides.
thb216.title: Eutropia the Twice-Favored

thb218.flavor: "Many have sought my weakness. All have failed."
thb218.title: Haktos the Unscarred

thb222.flavor: Three sharp barks announce an attempt to escape the Underworld. Three sharp bites end it.
thb222.title: Kunoros, Hound of Athreos

thb223.flavor: Some curiosities are best left alone.
thb223.title: Mischievous Chimera

thb225.flavor: A hero dies, and a legend arises.
thb225.title: Rise to Glory

thb227.flavor: "Mogis is pleased by this offering. Bring him more!"
thb227.title: Slaughter-Priest of Mogis

thb228.flavor:
"Only cowards flee from the truth."
—Perisophia the philosopher
thb228.title: Staggering Insight

thb230.flavor: "Strength, skill, rage—all have their limits, but patience can be infinite."
thb230.title: Warden of the Chained

thb232.flavor: Every strike of the smith's hammer infuses a sword with the determination of its creator.
thb232.title: Bronze Sword

thb233.flavor: Its strings are wayward threads of fate.
thb233.title: Entrancing Lyre

thb236.flavor: A weapon of darkness for a warrior of light.
thb236.title: Shadowspear

thb238.flavor: Meletian mages can't claim the title of thaumaturge until they have received a gift or omen from the gods. Ephara likes to give tangible tokens of her favor.
thb238.title: Thaumaturge's Familiar

thb239.flavor: In times of conflict, the philosophers of Meletis trade their podiums for conveyances of war.
thb239.title: Thundering Chariot

thb240.flavor: A vision of home, and a glimpse of hope.
thb240.title: Traveler's Amulet

thb241.flavor: Dalakos's invention worked . . . until it didn't.
thb241.title: Wings of Hubris

thb243.flavor: For centuries, the minotaur polis of Skophos was unknown to humans. It remains unexplored.
thb243.title: Labyrinth of Skophos

thb249.flavor: "Callaphe gazed on the coastline, certain her destiny called her here, where the mist-shrouded rocks sang, promising glories undreamed of." —The Callapheia
thb249.title: Unknown Shores

thb271.flavor:
"Agios was felled by a minotaur's blade, but I swear I have seen him since—in the midst of battle, wherever help is needed most."
—Phrokos, soldier of Akros
thb271.title: Eidolon of Inspiration

thb272.flavor: "For her, I would gladly die again."
thb272.title: Elspeth's Devotee

thb273.flavor:
"Even in her absence, the light Elspeth
kindled in our hearts never faltered."
thb273.title: Sunlit Hoplite

thb275.flavor: Ashiok's minions plumb the depths of the ocean and the psyche.
thb275.title: Swimmer in Nightmares

thb276.flavor: Harpies are among the most detested creatures in all of Theros . . . and they thoroughly deserve it.
thb276.title: Mindwrack Harpy

thb288.flavor: Mirinthes thought death was seconds away when the giant's fist closed around him. Two days later, he was praying for death's release.
thb288.title: Grasping Giant

thb289.flavor: Her paean is the clash of spears, her prayer a battle cry.
thb289.title: Victory's Envoy

thb290.flavor: Riddles draw you in, paradoxes hold you fast, and answers shatter your perceptions.
thb290.title: Sphinx Mindbreaker

thb291.flavor: "Gleams like moonlight on water drew us through the storm and toward our doom." —Siona, captain of the Pyleas
thb291.title: Serpent of Yawning Depths

thb292.flavor: Hatred is a potent ally, but an insatiable master.
thb292.title: Demon of Loathing

thb293.flavor: Deathless soldiers called phylaskia guard the borders of the Underworld.
thb293.title: Underworld Sentinel

thb294.flavor: Deathbellow Canyon echoes with the roars of minotaurs calling each other to battle.
thb294.title: Deathbellow War Cry

thb295.flavor: The forge of Purphoros burns in the heart of Mount Velus, attracting dragons with its blistering heat.
thb295.title: Terror of Mount Velus

thb296.flavor:
"Put down your bows, you fools! Arrows only make it angry!"
—Callia, Hyrax Tower scout
thb296.title: Ironscale Hydra

thb297.flavor: The wisdom of the past is written on the bones of ancients.
thb297.title: Treeshaker Chimera

mh1129.flavor: A mother only a child could love.
mh1129.title: Goblin Matron
